commit_message:
Limit requests version

Add <1.2.3 constraint to the requests version to avoid problems with old
versions of python clients. This constraint could be removed when all
clients will be released w/o such constraint and os/reqs will be updated
to support at least such versions of clients.

Change-Id: I3018357a6ac3f1cc7809bd091ec84aa11b83bf0c

commit_message:
Made Ambari RPM location configurable

The Ambari RPM location is now an ambari configuration property in
the blueprint.  This will support debug/issue resolution scenarios
as well as the export of this information.

Fixes:  bug #1208966

Change-Id: Ie0bfbd39d687c8c26d654b7fcfb369f764d48ef2
(cherry picked from commit f9a7b209083734a37ca8a6c844c785bf95c46772)

- add Endpoint type and move adminUrl, privateUrl into it
- add credential, host, addresses as optional attr of Resource
- add observer attr to event

Change-Id: I663eaf0b2f239300e035f084b8574e615c40a182
Fixes: Bug #1214097
'}]
commit_message:
update cadf spec to support new data model

- add Credential type and move token into it
- add Host type and move client_addr, agent into it
- add Endpoint type and move adminUrl, privateUrl into it
- add credential, host, addresses as optional attr of Resource
- add observer attr to event

Change-Id: I663eaf0b2f239300e035f084b8574e615c40a182
Fixes: Bug #1214097

commit_message:
Add dhcp_domain option to dhcp_agent.ini

This will allow you to set the domain dnsmasq hands out
to instances.
From: http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/openstack-network/admin/content/dhcp_agent_ini.html
dhcp_domain=openstacklocal  (StrOpt) Domain to use for building the host names.

Defaults to "openstacklocal"

Change-Id: Id963b7a6eeb7d57a5a0797d4e1e2981b8fd9e7a1

commit_message:
PowerDNS - Ensure SPF records are quoted correctly

PowerDNS requires SPF records to be quoted, unlike TXT records which
do not require the quotes.

Change-Id: I3aede09462fdf98dd9dd235e87127afb326f8711

commit_message:
Clear out service disabled reason on enable for V3 API

When a service gets re-enabled, clear out the 'disabled_reason' column.
Corresponding fix for the V3 API which was commited for the V2 api
in commit 16b4efdb0d488478c6f03218931bac4c42a278e3

Fixes bug 1212217

Change-Id: I3a5cc716f6c4929abaddf457b06f70f561789f38

[{'created': '2013-08-15 06:54:36.000000000', 'message': 'Removed the duplicated _host_state = None in libvirt driver

Happened to see there was a duplicated value assignment of host state
to None in __init__() in libvirt driver. Removed one of them.

Change-Id: I4d939f301c86b369b8f740bb18c9f3f6c77a674b
Signed-off-by: Shane Wang <shane.wang@intel.com>

commit_message:
Removed the duplicated _host_state = None in libvirt driver

Happened to see there was a duplicated value assignment of host state
to None in __init__() in libvirt driver. Removed one of them.

Change-Id: I4d939f301c86b369b8f740bb18c9f3f6c77a674b
Signed-off-by: Shane Wang <shane.wang@intel.com>

Any recommendations as to what to fix?'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2013-05-21 06:05:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

It would help if the gist could be updated to include that command that is throwing the traceback and to include the output of a pip freeze to get a list of package versions.

It does look like d2to1 may not be getting installed as part of the setup_requires steps. But without more information would be hard to say.

Monty does recommend performing a `python setup.py --version` before running other setup.py commands if you have an older version of distribute. You might try doing that to see if it helps.'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-05-23 14:45:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Understood, likely an old version of something (we're still using Lucid for some older machines). I probably wouldn't worry about it. If this patch lands I'll just update our build system somehow. Worst case, I'll plop in a more standard setup.py and versioning without all the extras."}, {'account_id': 917, 'date': '2013-05-24 22:35:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

So is there any overall document that describes exactly what this buys us?

I'm not sure I'm really keen moving what is pretty standard python setup.py stuff to configuration file magic."}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-05-25 12:17:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

One of the direct wins for swift here is the tag-based-versioning, which swift has not been interested in accepting until it could be encapsulated into an external library. Additionally, it allows us to appropriately bootstrap into a common build library, which due to the horrendous design of stock setuptools is a continual chicken-and-egg problem.

The underlying library, d2to1, is a library that is bringing the distutils2 setup.cfg style build config to current codebases, so while it's not common yet, setup.cfg vs. setup.py will become more and more common. Since distutils2 is stalled upstream, that effort may take a little while longer, but in general the idea of a declarative setup syntax is seen as the future that python wants to get to.

There was more discussion of the project-wide build topic at the last summit, summarized here:

https://etherpad.openstack.org/havana-oslo-packaging-and-hacking"}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-05-25 12:21:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

gholt- workaround for old build systems - simply run:

python setup.py --version

Before you run the other things. It's a low-impact command that will cause the setup_requires to be fetched. (older distribute has a bug that prevents properly re-initializing itself after grapping a setup_requires)

However, you might find it better, depending on what you're doing packaging wise, to package d2to1 and pbr themselves and then Build-Depend on them, which will cause them to be installed first in the build env, which will avoid the need for any workarounds at all."}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-05-25 12:38:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Work In Progress

Need to land amended authors/changelog skipping first.'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-05-25 15:58:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Ah cool, I will try the "python setup.py --version" next time 'round.'}, {'account_id': 917, 'date': '2013-05-25 16:06:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

I would have hated this, but I already packaged up d2to1, pbr, and setuptools-git to be able to package python-swiftclient... so now I don't care. ;)

FWIW, pbr got the version  wrong on the branch/tag I was trying to package python-swiftclient from, so I ended up having to override it with a magic env var in our package build infrastructure, so for *me* pbr was completely useless and adding more packaging work.  I understand that's not the case (hopefully!) for other packagers."}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-07-12 17:14:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Monty, can we get a status update on this?  Is there really some notion of somehow pbr being only a build time depends?!  I have no idea how that would work.

I only ever install from source and pypi, so this doesn't effect me.

I hear some people use packages from RDO and CloudArchive, i'm guessing pbr is a done deal there?

My strategy for building packages for master is currently "let swifterdarrell figure it out" and before that it was "let gholt figure it out" - if they don't +2 this patch I don't know anyone will.

Which is maybe too bad, especially since it seems for them so far; it's mostly been just "one more thing to do" and I *do* actually believe in openstack-infra needing to standardize to automate efficiently.

Last thing, looking at the effected projects on bug # 1179007 is making me feel like an ugly step-sister, do other people just not even *question* a new dependency!?  Still, if chasing this thing down for us is keeping Monty from working on other things we're really probably not being fair to ourselves (functests in the gate) or other projects - doing what's best for swift is one thing; but is *this* really *so* bad?

Dunno...'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-07-14 19:35:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Hey Clay - I'm actually working on landing two changes to pbr and then making another release before I bring this one back up with you guys again. One of the main changes will be the removal of pbr's dependency on setuptools_git, which makes pbr itself a VERY lightweight dependency to have. The other is a feature to pbr.version that makes life better for distro packagers, which will make the argument stronger for why you should accept it as a runtime dependency as well. But I've been silent on this patch for now because I wanted to come back and address the concerns in a more complete manner. I think maybe I should mark it work in progress though to indicate that I am working on it..."}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-07-14 19:35:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-08-04 19:22:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 7680, 'date': '2013-08-04 19:31:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I guess I'm using this wrong.

After installing (from source with python ./setup.py develop) swift on my SAIO, this patch causes swift.__version__ to be 1.8.0.rc1.420.g02fa974. This sorts (much) older than the current version (1.9.2-dev), and as such it cannot be used. Why is this happening? Is it because tags are on a milestone-proposed branch and not master? What is the proper procedure? How are other projects managing this?"}, {'account_id': 2828, 'date': '2013-08-08 05:23:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

So we'll have to install pbr and pip>=1.0 to run swift now?"}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-08-09 13:41:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 7680, 'date': '2013-08-09 13:43:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2013-08-09 14:14:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Monty, I'd love comments on Michael's question. I my limited testing, this requires pbr and VCS info to be available at install time (eg `python ./setup.py develop`). So there will probably be some issues with extra requirements to packagers. I don't think pbr is required at runtime. Can you confirm?

Alex, are you arguing over the spelling of invented words? ;-)"}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-08-09 14:18:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-08-09 14:18:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but commit message has changed.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-08-09 14:21:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Michael - pbr yes, for now, pip no. If you install swift via pip, or via python setup.py install and expect for the dependencies to get installed that way as well, then yes. There is an env var that can be set for your debian/rpm packaging "SKIP_PIP_INSTALL" that will cause all pip things to be completely ignored - including the declared pip dependency. (this will cause _all_ dependencies to be ignored, but in that case it's expected that you're having dpkg/rpm handle that for you)'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2013-08-09 14:33:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

For example, today we'd need a tag named 1.9.2-dev.

'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-08-20 19:45:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

So I spent some time going over the changes that would be necessary to move our build system to PBR.  Mainly it just requires escape hatching the git based tagging and build time dependency installation as documented here: 

    http://docs.openstack.org/developer/pbr/packagers.html

These changes are quite manageable, and basically provide a legacy and backwards-compatible packaging behavior that looks and feels like packaging most any other python package for ubuntu/deb or cent/rpm.

As Darrell already pointed out, in our case, PBR offers no benefit because we support a number of older distros, and we have to package (i.e. backport) a number of other dependencies.  Because none of these other packages use or support PBR, it's easier to treat swift as the one off than to rework the process to take advantage of PBR in the one package where we could theoretically use it.

I had some outstanding correspondence to other community members that have worked with PBR in other projects and packaging swift - although most took the opportunity to vent that PBR had caused them more grief that gratitude early on, no one has indicated that they currently have any issues with PBR, or that swift adding it as a requirement would require any egregious amount of effort.

As such I'm inclined to follow Monty's lead, and move swift inline with python-swiftclient and the other OpenStack projects.

Rather than waiting for imminent merge, we really should get a 1.9.2 tag on the origin repo *now* so the git based versioning works in sane fashion for review.  I don't really care about 1.9.2-dev which doesn't parse by distutils.version.StrictVersion *anyway*.

As follow up work it would be nice if the swift's sphinx docs included some notes on building packages - and particularly a link to the PBR "Notes for Packagers".

An email should be sent to the ML when this lands so everyone can get started on fixing their debian and .spec files.

I hope all this effort is useful work to someone.'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2013-08-20 20:06:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: No score

removing my -2

we still need the tag (as clay mentioned) before this can land'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2013-08-20 22:36:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

master was tagged as 1.9.2, so this now works'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-20 22:36:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: No score

Starting gate jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-08-20 22:41:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

As a quick follow up to Clay - thank you, that's an excellent comment. I'm hoping that the early issues we saw around pbr in the other projects were all learning experiences and will have been straightened out for you guys. My hope is that after this, you will never notice that it's there - but that it will allow us to ensure more consistent behavior across the board for the integrated gate (essentially, I'm hoping if we can align things like this, that we'll have less false negatives in the gate, which means less times of another project slowing you guys down)

That's the hope at least. I appreciate having you on board!"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-21 11:49:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Verified

[{'created': '2013-05-11 19:45:52.000000000', 'message': 'Migrate to pbr for build.

pbr is the librification of what was openstack.common.setup. As part of
this, d2to1 is brought in, which allows for the build information to be
expressed in a delcarative form, instead of as executable python code.

One of the features that comes along with this is versioning based on
git tags. If the current revision is a signed git tag, then that is the
version of the package. If it is not, the version is equal to the most
recent git tag, plus a commit count, plus a git sha (similar to git
describe, but scrubbed for python version rules compliance)

Fixes bug 1179007

Change-Id: Ia473960be7e8aa44f09d48cea72ed3c8845f82fa

commit_message:
Migrate to pbr for build

pbr is the libification of what was openstack.common.setup. If provides
the build information in a delcarative form, instead of as executable python
code, which works around the chicken and egg problem of needing setup
libraries present to run setup, but needing to run setup to tell if you
need setup libraries.

One of the features that comes along with this is versioning based on
git tags. If the current revision is a signed git tag, then that is the
version of the package. If it is not, the version is equal to the most
recent git tag, plus a commit count, plus a git sha (similar to git
describe, but scrubbed for python version rules compliance)

pbr updates are also part of the upcoming automation around ensuring
global requirements stay in sync.

Closes-Bug: #1179007
Change-Id: Ia473960be7e8aa44f09d48cea72ed3c8845f82fa

Yes this still supports user environments. But they are uploaded at the time of stack create/update not interdependently.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-07-24 15:46:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

An observation: under no circumstances can we allow the user-provided environment to refer to file:/// urls on the heat-engine host, so the global environment has to be a special case anyway. Given that, maybe it's just easier to provide a class that makes creating a plugin from a provider template (i.e. for the RDS/LoadBalancer resources) trivial.

I agree that the Resource selection logic could use some tidy-up/consolidation though."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-01 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-23 12:23:54.000000000', 'message': 'RFC: Wrap the resource registration in a global environment

move resource class registration into a global environment

Change-Id: I065dadc9fae19ab21d6d4aeae08334f20da161bb
'}, {'created': '2013-08-09 01:55:01.000000000', 'message': 'Wrap the resource registration in a global environment

- move resource class registration into a global environment
- move the TemplateResource template retrieval into the environment

This allows for a global environment that the deployer can use to set
their own defaults.
An example /etc/heat/environment.yaml

resource_registry:
  "OS::Quantum*": "OS::Neutron*"
  "AWS::RDS::DBInstance": "file:///etc/heat/templates/AWS_RDS_DBInstance.template"

Change-Id: I065dadc9fae19ab21d6d4aeae08334f20da161bb
'}, {'created': '2013-08-09 03:12:31.000000000', 'message': 'Wrap the resource registration in a global environment

commit_message:
Make RPCPublisher flush method threadsafe

This change allow concurrent access to the local queue of the
RPCPublisher

Fixes bug #1211736

Change-Id: I13371329d40e43f42c357a0893e4023f343a5efa

Also you use mox in tests - is it correct?'}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2013-08-07 09:43:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: (1 inline comment)

As for mox vs mock and the whole 'we need to be py3k compatible' madness - I didn't see any decision made that there will be only mock used from now on. The mailing list discussion seems to hover around 'mock maybe but pymox is fine also maybe'.

I personally don't see it as a wortwile effort enough to -1 patches that have been up for a month (!), just because someone put up a blueprint (still in discussion). I actually think it's a huge waste of time so I do not plan to change this unless I get -1s from core reviewers only over this.

Just because something is in the standard library doesn't mean everyone in the world needs to move towards it and stop writing other code - IM(ns)HO."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-07 09:50:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Works for me

Since some PY3 compatibility questions have raised here, I think it's reasonable to ask Doug Hellman and Eric Windisch to take a quick look at this patch.

Doug, can you please help us to come up with a consensus here? I couldn't find Eric in gerrit, so I will ping him in IRC."}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2013-08-07 12:54:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

Hey Roman,

There are no 'some py3k compatibility questions raised here' - there is only mox usage questioned - and afaict - there is no final concensus on this.

Having said that - I am strongly against mindless -1s over it especially for large feature branches like this one (and so close to freeze) - and it is unlikely that even adding Guido to the review will change my mind."}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2013-08-07 12:56:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2013-08-07 12:58:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-08-07 13:50:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

In general, I do think we should start moving to mock.  However, we have a *lot* of existing mox usage, and a path has already been identified that makes them Python 3 compatible (pymox), so I think it's ok to let some more mox tests in a case like this (has been up for a while, and before we had a discussion about moving toward mock)."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-08-07 14:10:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

See also e.g. http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-July/012484.html

I think anyone writing whole new test cases should use mock, but if someone is adding new tests to existing test cases our whatever, it's not on them to port to mox"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-08-07 14:13:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

Ok, so Nikola is adding a new test case which uses mox

Even here I'm sympathetic to Nikola - you put a tonne of work into a feature, using the same testing approach used everywhere else, some discussion happens on a mailing list and suddenly you're the first one to be subject to a new policy

IMHO, it's fine to merge these tests with their mox usage. It's a drop in the ocean compared to the rest of the mox usage in Nova."}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2013-08-07 18:59:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-07 20:17:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14: Doesn't seem to work

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-29 14:32:14.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor how bdm is handled when booting

This patch refactors how block devices are handled when booting VMs.
Also it introduces new block device mapping format in the run_instance
manager method of the compute service.

The refactoring is done by creating a simple hierarchy of
DriverBlockDevice classes that are meant to:

1) Provide a common place to keep information about the data that is
kept for each block device type

2) Encapsulate the logic of "attaching" the device from the compute
service point of view (driver will still need to do the actual work).

Currently we have special subclasses for ephemeral, swap, volume and
snapshot devices.

These classes also make it possible to easily provide
the drivers that will require old block device mappings using the
legacy() method.

Another advantage of this refactoring brings is that adding additional
block devices, like Image block devices (coming soon in a subsequent
patch) that can have destination type of either a hypervisor image or a
volume will be just a matter of extending the base class and redefining
attach to do the work of creating the volume if needed.

blueprint: improve-block-device-handling

Change-Id: I5b9c3e2d959c602fa22f49db681da918ae0adcea

'}, {'created': '2013-08-06 08:22:58.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor how BDMs are handled when booting

This patch refactors how block devices are handled when booting VMs.
Also it introduces new block device mapping format in the run_instance
manager method of the compute service.

The refactoring is done by creating a simple hierarchy of
DriverBlockDevice classes that are meant to:

1) Provide a common place to keep information about the data that is
kept for each block device type

2) Encapsulate the logic of "attaching" the device from the compute
service point of view (driver will still need to do the actual work).

Currently we have special subclasses for ephemeral, swap, volume and
snapshot devices.

These classes also make it possible to easily provide
the drivers that will require old block device mapping format with it by
overriding the legacy() method.

Another advantage that this refactoring brings is that adding additional
block device types, like Image block devices (coming soon in a subsequent
patch) that can have destination type of either a hypervisor image or a
volume will be just a matter of extending the base class and redefining
attach to do the work of creating the volume if needed.

blueprint: improve-block-device-handling

Change-Id: I5b9c3e2d959c602fa22f49db681da918ae0adcea

commit_message:
Refactor how BDMs are handled when booting

This patch refactors how block devices are handled when booting VMs.
Also it introduces new block device mapping format in the run_instance
manager method of the compute service.

The refactoring is done by creating a simple hierarchy of
DriverBlockDevice classes that are meant to:

1) Provide a common place to keep information about the data that is
kept for each block device type

2) Encapsulate the logic of "attaching" the device from the compute
service point of view (driver will still need to do the actual work).

Currently we have special subclasses for ephemeral, swap, volume and
snapshot devices.

These classes also make it possible to easily provide
the drivers that will require old block device mapping format with it by
overriding the legacy() method.

Another advantage that this refactoring brings is that adding additional
block device types, like Image block devices (coming soon in a subsequent
patch) that can have destination type of either a hypervisor image or a
volume will be just a matter of extending the base class and redefining
attach to do the work of creating the volume if needed.

blueprint: improve-block-device-handling

Change-Id: I5b9c3e2d959c602fa22f49db681da918ae0adcea

[{'created': '2013-08-19 16:18:51.000000000', 'message': "Fix isEnabledFor for compatibility with logging

After refactoring Keystone to use the unified logging implementation
from Oslo-incubator there were some issues using isEnabledFor with the
ContextAdapter provided in keystone/openstack/common/log.py. This
removes those calls and adds a check in keystone/common/wsgi.py to
handle the case where Keystone is running Python 2.6, in which
ContextAdapter doesn't have 'isEnabledFor'.

fixes bug 1213284

Change-Id: I8c64b12dcd9d955c96dc5a48348555ff37b15116
"}, {'created': '2013-08-20 13:38:40.000000000', 'message': "Fix isEnabledFor for compatibility with logging

After refactoring Keystone to use the unified logging implementation
from Oslo-incubator there were some issues using isEnabledFor with the
ContextAdapter provided in keystone/openstack/common/log.py. This
removes those calls and adds a check in keystone/common/wsgi.py to
handle the case where Keystone is running Python 2.6, in which
ContextAdapter doesn't have 'isEnabledFor'.

fixes bug 1213284

Change-Id: I8c64b12dcd9d955c96dc5a48348555ff37b15116
"}]
commit_message:
Fix isEnabledFor for compatibility with logging

After refactoring Keystone to use the unified logging implementation
from Oslo-incubator there were some issues using isEnabledFor with the
ContextAdapter provided in keystone/openstack/common/log.py. This
removes those calls and adds a check in keystone/common/wsgi.py to
handle the case where Keystone is running Python 2.6, in which
ContextAdapter doesn't have 'isEnabledFor'.

fixes bug 1213284

Change-Id: I8c64b12dcd9d955c96dc5a48348555ff37b15116

Rename InvalidInstanceIDMalformed to InvalidInstanceIDMalformedEC2
and add ec2_code attribute to make it proper EC2 API exception.

Implements: blueprint ec2-error-codes
Change-Id: I8841f79890e087b850801bf71da0512bd329d5df

commit_message:
Make InvalidInstanceIDMalformed an EC2 exception

Rename InvalidInstanceIDMalformed to InvalidInstanceIDMalformedEC2
and add ec2_code attribute to make it proper EC2 API exception.

Implements: blueprint ec2-error-codes
Change-Id: I8841f79890e087b850801bf71da0512bd329d5df

commit_message:
Assignment to reserved built-in symbol: filter

In keystone/common/controller.py, filterprotected::_filterprotected(),
built-in symbol filter was re-assignment as local vars, it is easily
lead to a misunderstanding, so rename them.
This patch do not modify any functionality.

Change-Id: I6e7965b445496c7ad140e8320ded61706d62895e

[{'created': '2013-08-16 08:06:59.000000000', 'message': 'Fix "Add Association" and "Delete Association" displaying

This patch adds "ajax-modal" class to LBaaS "Add Health Monitor"
and "Delete Health Monitor" links. So these links open pop-up
windows with "Cancel" and "Add"/"Delete" buttons.

Fixes bug 1212978

Change-Id: Ie5a02ca07a9ee09abbbfd0b32db5141069e4adbe
'}]
commit_message:
Fix "Add Association" and "Delete Association" displaying

This patch adds "ajax-modal" class to LBaaS "Add Health Monitor"
and "Delete Health Monitor" links. So these links open pop-up
windows with "Cancel" and "Add"/"Delete" buttons.

Fixes bug 1212978

Make the SolidFire driver api port configurable.

Making the SolidFire driver api port configurable allows it to be
placed behind a transparent proxy.

Change-Id: I976ecfd5df11797722776faf65777ca1ffa5b0c4

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-20 18:53:26.000000000', 'message': "Enhance delayed message translation when _ is imported

Delayed message translation currently doesn't work for
messages written from files that import the _ function
directly.  For example:

from ceilometer.openstack.common.gettextutils import _

This change uses new support added to oslo that enables
lazy text translation in files where _ is imported
directly.

Implements bp user-locale-api

Change-Id: Ib2189836c6bbeb7e242a77415424fa77af5366f5
"}]
commit_message:
Enhance delayed message translation when _ is imported

Delayed message translation currently doesn't work for
messages written from files that import the _ function
directly.  For example:

from ceilometer.openstack.common.gettextutils import _

This change uses new support added to oslo that enables
lazy text translation in files where _ is imported
directly.

Implements bp user-locale-api

Change-Id: Ib2189836c6bbeb7e242a77415424fa77af5366f5

commit_message:
Implemented test-scenarios for storage tests

Rename is needed to make tests loader work with test scenarios
since it works with files starting with test_*

Implements blueprint db-tests-with-scenarios

Change-Id: I8f776f2538ef2405a0dc3e34b024f37f174e902d

commit_message:
Improve consistency of quota checking in forms

Add quota based validations to floating_ips and instance forms. Unify
the implementation of disabled/enabled button for instance and
floating_ips table. Add disabled/enalbed button to volumes table.

Change-Id: I488e86e467369f35244bdcd34ecaaee32e56ba2d
fixes: bug #1070899

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-21 06:37:46.000000000', 'message': "Add a Notifier.prepare() method

Nova sends notifications with a bunch of different publisher_ids, so we
instantiate quite a lot of Notifier objects. Loading the noification
drivers for each of these is a substantial amount of overhead.

One obvious answer would be to make publisher_id an argument to the
error(), info(), etc. methods, but I think it's nice to encapsulate the
publisher_id in a notifier instance.

Instead, add a prepare() method which mirrors the approach in RPCClient.
You use this method to create a specialized notifier instance with a new
publisher_id.

Change-Id: Ia45fda3164086bb7a9ef6dee0587f726ab8b1a97
"}]
commit_message:
Add a Notifier.prepare() method

Nova sends notifications with a bunch of different publisher_ids, so we
instantiate quite a lot of Notifier objects. Loading the noification
drivers for each of these is a substantial amount of overhead.

One obvious answer would be to make publisher_id an argument to the
error(), info(), etc. methods, but I think it's nice to encapsulate the
publisher_id in a notifier instance.

Instead, add a prepare() method which mirrors the approach in RPCClient.
You use this method to create a specialized notifier instance with a new
publisher_id.

Change-Id: Ia45fda3164086bb7a9ef6dee0587f726ab8b1a97

commit_message:
Check is_public of flavor when creating a instance

If creating a flavor with is_public "false", the flavor should be
accessible by admin or user who is granted to access.
The commit I5b37fa0bb19683fe1642fd81222547d4a317054e has fixed the
"list flavors" and "get flavor details" API.
This patch fixes "create an instance" API.

Fixes bug #1212179

Change-Id: I3bdd9485d31cec32b6fc83b6eed4ee46fd5fe91f

commit_message:
Split console type detection

Avoid code duplication by splitting console type detection from
second part data lookup and formatting.

Implements: blueprint spice-http-proxy
Change-Id: Ida8f11f8e5606c183fab1ac08d58e54675a26c49

commit_message:
Search filters for get_all_system_metadata should use lists

The search filter should have the form:
[{'foo'}: ['bar'], {'baz'}: ['quux']]

The underlying code accidentally and unfortunately allows filters that look like
[{'foo'}: 'bar', {'baz'}: 'quux'], but that is not guaranteed to work in the future.

Change-Id: Ic28612c8c843194e2f4f6918166177813fd5dee3

commit_message:
GPFS support for various volume attributes

Specify the following attributes when creating a new volume:

* The storage pool on which the volume is placed
* Number of block-level replicas
* Whether the physical blocks should be allocated locally on the node issuing
  the IO or striped across the cluster
* Whether writes to the volume should use direct IO
* Number of file system blocks to be laid out sequentially on disk to behave
  like a single large block
* Local storage attached to specific node(s) where the replicas of the
  volume should be allocated

Change-Id: I77bb7de32bbde5a125f8c6f9a727b538ea99bc18
Implements: blueprint gpfs-volume-attributes

I will do a thorough review of this patch ASAP. My only comment so far is that the term "transport zone" may not be as generic as we'd like, and may imply a certain use case. The ml2 plugin has been using the term "segment" (as in Ethernet segments connected by hubs/switches) for the same concept. Would that be acceptable? commit_message:
Add multiple provider network extension

The following commit adds the ability to associate multiple
different provider networks on a single network.

Implements blueprint map-networks-to-multiple-provider-networks

Change-Id: I3c70fb2426899f728a401566debab7f66e7246bc

commit_message:
Display the container and object metadata

Display some of the useful metadata information from swift:
Container Details - Container Name, Object Count, Size
Object Details - Name, Hash, Content Type, Last Modified, Size

Change-Id: I6611cab08946a81624176c1836ceadaf16a68e45
Implements: blueprint swift-display-metadata

commit_message:
Implement assignment of Project Roles to Group

Added Project Groups step in the Project workflow for managing
project-role assignment to Groups.

The feature is only enabled if the application is running KS V3.

Moved the logic for filtering Groups by Domain into keystone.py.

Change-Id: I48b1aba162646a5327f6442a864e2015596a99c6
Implements: blueprint group-role-assignment

Looks great. 

Although I must say I liked the instance method reboot more. The thing with useless 'get' can be resolved easily by lazy loading of the API object only when needed. Eg. when some of the _attrs of ApiResourceWrapper is needed, it will fetch the object.

It's then encapsulated and abstracted properly. You just call server.action and you don't care, whether it's needs to call several API calls, before it can execute the action. It's another layer problem.

There is a blueprint, pushing things towards a proper API layer https://blueprints.launchpad.net/horizon/+spec/api-wrapper-modules

Just saying. :-)"}, {'account_id': 4978, 'date': '2013-08-20 16:47:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thanks for the review and I hear you, this certainly would be nice! Currently though, every API call related to server is called in its own method except for reboot, so IMO it makes sense to make it more consistent with what is already there.'}, {'account_id': 1941, 'date': '2013-08-20 17:52:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Clean-up code issues related to reboot

 - Don't import nova client directly in a panel, client details should
   only live in openstack_dashboard/api
 - "allowed()" now checks if instances is None, which can happen with
   BatchActions
 - Remove unused reboot() method from Server
 - Fix import order for 'logging' module

Fixes: bug #1213853

Change-Id: I56f810c6d451d68cb8326a0fa4f89462f74e9bf7

Thanks
Gary"}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2013-07-30 16:14:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Change detaching interface to synchronous

Like attaching interface, detaching interface should also be synchronous,
so the failures in nova-compute could return for API callers.

Change-Id: I46a02eff5e4f92770988c23b9580a0d229b946c6
Fixes: bug #1205951

[{'created': '2013-08-13 17:53:40.000000000', 'message': "Add a tox env for future-facing flake8

flake8 can run checks on just the patch in question. If we turn this on,
it can let us enforce not breaking things in new patches, even if the
codebase overall can't handle the check.

Change-Id: Ibdebdbd4d50c5ef63b1f779130022c07307578e0
"}]
commit_message:
Add a tox env for future-facing flake8

flake8 can run checks on just the patch in question. If we turn this on,
it can let us enforce not breaking things in new patches, even if the
codebase overall can't handle the check.

Change-Id: Ibdebdbd4d50c5ef63b1f779130022c07307578e0

'}, {'account_id': 6493, 'date': '2013-08-12 20:34:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

(1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-08-12 20:47:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Hold on. . . 

Did you notice that one of the locations is marked as deleted?

Are we just calling locations_set more than once?"}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-08-12 20:54:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I see that you did note that one of the locations was soft-deleted in the bug ticket, now.

I wonder if we should just have the v1 api not end up calling create or update with the location multiple times?'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-08-12 20:56:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Sorry for the rapid fire posting.

The issue here is, is it valid to have two locations with the same url but with different metadata?'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-08-13 19:04:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Do not merge

I've been thinking more and more about this, since talking with Venkatesh in IRC.

The conclusion that makes the most sense to me now is that in the api, locations are a list, not a dictionary keyed by url. So we would be ill-advised to start treating locations as keyed by url in the db driver.

Instead, we may need to look at ways to make the ordering of locations explicit (especially since json patch would want to manipulate locations based on their relative ordering)."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-21 06:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-21 06:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

the bug discussion for more information.

Fixes Bug1172106

Add tests for message expiration on claims

This patch set adds tests to verify that the message TTL is extended,
when a claim is made.

Tests: blueprint claimed-message-grace

commit_message:
Allow Keystone to update user name with LDAP back end

Remove 'name' check in update_user to make sure
user can update user name.
Add duplicate check to make sure duplicate name
cannot be updated.

Fixes bug 1211643.

Change-Id: Iebb31faa9287dd7061ae47b8efe92e4f55ffbcab

lgtm!'}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2013-07-22 16:39:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-07-24 20:22:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I had thought maybe it made sense for other projects to move tests out of their libraries, to make life easier for packagers. . .'}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-07-24 20:42:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not merge

Hey,

I'm -2'ing this because we had a different plan for tests. 

The tl;dr of the idea is that we want to keep actual tests in the app root and tests classes in the package root.

python-glanceclient/tests <- actual tests ran by tox
python-glanceclient/glanceclient/tests <- tests classes and common code

We'll start doing this in glance soon and once that's done we want to do it here as well.

Any thoughts about this?"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-01 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-01 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-08-14 01:48:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Restored'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-08-14 01:52:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Flavio - sorry, I missed your feedback.

I'd really like to not have anything in the project roots with a tests dir - mainly for the reasons I was listing before:

- tests/__init__.py indicates a python package with the name "tests" - this means you will need, in your test code, to do something like "from tests import foo". I'm assuming that the "put things I expect other people to import into glanceclient/tests"

- If the tests aren't in the package, then it's impossible for people to consume them in ways you were not expecting. Especially in something like openstack, where you might want to do something, say to glance with a local plugin, and then test that you didn't break glanceclient- having the unittests in the installed package is helpful

- It's python code. It takes up no space. Why make a more complex layout?'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-08-14 02:05:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6493, 'date': '2013-08-14 02:20:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Flavio, can you link to some information about the plan for tests?  What Monty is saying here makes sense to me so without more information I am inclined to agree with him.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-14 02:47:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

commit_message:
Move tests into glanceclient.

This makes them consistent with glance, for one, and also consistent
with the majority of OpenStack projects. Additionally, tests/__init__.py
is implying a global tests package, which is not what glanceclient uses.
These tests are specific to glanceclient, not global in scope.

Change-Id: I51d7563fa2879963137afeab0911ec712595def3

Remove User Check from Assignments

Removed tests that assume too tight a coupling between identity
and assignment backends.

Bug 1211388

subject: Add dogpile.cache>=0.5.0 to requirements
messages:
[{'account_id': 7680, 'date': '2013-08-17 04:39:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Doesn't seem to be packaged for ubuntu yet, I don't have a sense of whether that should be a blocker (https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Requirements only says to *prefer* packaged items), it is packaged for fedora. It otherwise meats all criteria and is a known best of breed solution."}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2013-08-17 04:42:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Alex Gaynor - is it an issue that the packaged version for fedora is 0.4.2?  I can work around the benefits of 0.5.0 if that is preferred.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-17 05:17:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-08-17 11:25:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Any reason you choose to use 0.5.0 (the latest release). Some distros already have 0.4 in them so it might be nice to know the reasons behind choosing the latest version...'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2013-08-17 21:39:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Dan Prince,

0.5.0 has the should_cache_fn argument to the decorator, which allows for a cleaned mechanism to toggle caching per location that is desired to be cached instead of needing separate CacheRegion objects with custom backends to disable caching.  There is also the concept of a ProxyBackend which allows for layering in enhancements to the backend without having to develop a complete new backend (and separate CacheRegion object)

If there is a need to move to 0.4.x since it is already available in some distros, I can work around (and am open to) not having these convenience features.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-08-18 00:31:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I think the reasons listed sound like a good reason to focus on the newer version. We should still be before feature freeze of Ubuntu and Fedora, yeah?'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-08-20 17:40:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-20 17:40:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

commit_message:
Add dogpile.cache>=0.5.0 to requirements

dogpile.cache is the caching library of choice for caching that is
being implemented in keystone.

Change-Id: I1a8a39bb286e15853959b21edf242b28a9a8f4bb
related-blueprint: caching-layer-for-driver-calls

commit_message:
Removed need for domain in 3PAR drivers

The 3PAR drivers need to support CPGs that are not part of a
virtual domain on the 3PAR backend. This patch removes the need
for the CPG to be part of a domain and changes a few of the commands
that took the domain as an option.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I7e472e19e484e837c9216ea01455a4b8a85b19e5
Fixes: bug #1212328

Just a nitpick: What about the previous tate where you could have can_edit=True without having multi-domain support enabled?'}, {'account_id': 1941, 'date': '2013-08-15 23:03:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Good catch, I actually thought about that when I updated the code but didn't put it in the comments.

In that scenario, the operator have setup to run in Keystone V3 with single Domain model.

The login screen would not prompt the user for Domain name and would use the value on the config OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_DEFAULT_DOMAIN when providing the Domain name on authentication with Keystone.

Because of this, if the admin modifies the Domain name in the screen it won't sync with what's in the settings file and the authentication will fail. 

I would expect that for single-Domain model, the admin would never want to modify the Domain information."}, {'account_id': 5623, 'date': '2013-08-16 15:08:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-14 22:07:37.000000000', 'message': 'Always display the Domains panel for Keystone V3

The Domains panel is only displayed when the user explicitly set
the OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_MULTIDOMAIN_SUPPORT to True and keystone
supports V3.

The change allows the Domain panel to be displayed even if the flag
OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_MULTIDOMAIN_SUPPORT is False. In this case, the
CRUD actions will not be available in the panel.

If the local_settings.py.example is taken as is, Keystone V3 is
assumed to be available. The Domain panel should also be available.

Change-Id: Ifa81c6f106ba98a192a163aeb80f0ff92888d954
Fixes: bug 1211667
'}]
commit_message:
Always display the Domains panel for Keystone V3

The Domains panel is only displayed when the user explicitly set
the OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_MULTIDOMAIN_SUPPORT to True and keystone
supports V3.

The change allows the Domain panel to be displayed even if the flag
OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_MULTIDOMAIN_SUPPORT is False. In this case, the
CRUD actions will not be available in the panel.

If the local_settings.py.example is taken as is, Keystone V3 is
assumed to be available. The Domain panel should also be available.

Change-Id: Ifa81c6f106ba98a192a163aeb80f0ff92888d954
Fixes: bug 1211667

[{'created': '2013-08-14 16:02:37.000000000', 'message': 'Hide default Floating IPs quotas with Neutron

It is not possible to access the default quotas via an API for
Neutron. Remove the quota in that case for now, as it comes from Nova
and could cause confusion.

Partial-Bug: #1109140

Change-Id: If8df21b4ecbe541ce53790578820e22f36c32260
'}]
commit_message:
Hide default Floating IPs quotas with Neutron

It is not possible to access the default quotas via an API for
Neutron. Remove the quota in that case for now, as it comes from Nova
and could cause confusion.

Partial-Bug: #1109140

Change-Id: If8df21b4ecbe541ce53790578820e22f36c32260

commit_message:
Remove upper bounds on lifeless test libraries

Robert assures us that he's not going to break backwards compat. We know
where he lives, so if he does, we can all just point our fingers and
laugh - but for now I think it's fair to take him at his word.

Change-Id: Ica3bdeceb1c6da3eb3d7d432ce7eb22cf61f1100

commit_message:
Enforce flavor access during instance boot

The code in the servers API did not pass the context when retrieving
flavor details.  That means it would use an admin context instead,
bypassing all flavor access control checks.

This patch includes the fix, and the corresponding unit test, for both
the v2 and v3 APIs.

Closes-bug: #1212179

Change-Id: I681ae9965e19767df22fa74c3315e4e03a459d3b

Fix processutils.execute errors on windows

Added a check for existence of geteuid

Fixes LP# 1209410

Change-Id: I75a7343aa93761a7dcec3640245c7de945b9ce0a

commit_message:
Remove skip of neutron connectivity check

Devstack has been updated to ensure the metadata proxy is correctly
configured, which should resolve the test failure.

Closes-Bug: #1210664

Change-Id: Ibff5e4146be297180529337683b384768f46cf54

RBAC rules defined in a policy.json to the REST resource API methods they need to
protect for unauthorized access. The implementation utilizes the latest oslo policy
module updates to read, parse and enforce RBAC rules.

commit_message:
Add role based access control (RBAC) to Barbican

Barbican must support RBAC on its various REST methods. This commit adds logic to enforce
RBAC rules defined in a policy.json to the REST resource API methods they need to
protect for unauthorized access. The implementation utilizes the latest oslo policy
module updates to read, parse and enforce RBAC rules.

Change-Id: I94b1709532540947ab3f1c9878c883a1fd167183
Implements: blueprint rbac-add-support

commit_message:
Fixes some puppet lint warnings

This commit fixes the following warnings:
manifests/compute/libvirt.pp - WARNING: double quoted string containing no variables on line 31
manifests/init.pp - WARNING: class inheriting from params class on line 77

attribute. The test, test_attach_detach_volume was failing because it

commit_message:
Set missing attribute self.server in _create_and_attach utility

Modifies _create_and_attach utility method so that it sets self.server
attribute. The test, test_attach_detach_volume was failing because it
expected the attribute to be set but it was not.

Fixes: bug #1214219
Change-Id: I88222cdf264e938f492058ab2d476406074aea40

commit_message:
Specify version 1.0.0 for hp3parclient

The 1.0.0 version of the client is the only version that will
work with Grizzly.  We are about to release 2.0.0, which will not
work on Grizzly. (Grizzly doc change ONLY)

Change-Id: Ib753d827f9a2f28d34f96847335d0e3c09d687cf
Fixes: bug #1214655

commit_message:
Fix bug#1188150 Add --force quota-update option to nova cli commands

This fix documents a new Havana-related option to force update when running 'nova quota-update'.

Also added periods to option definitions for consistency

author: nerminamiller
bug: #1188150
Change-Id: Ic4775d553c8cbf927e92247ead6503bd76e96732

validate.py did not give any progress ahead of which books are going to
get build which is a bit annoying if you run it locally.

With my patch you see:
$ tools/validate.py

Following files will be validated:
>>> doc/src/docbkx/openstack-network-connectivity-admin/app_demo_routers_with_private_networks.xml

Queuing the following books for building:
  openstack-network-connectivity-admin
Building all books now...
>>> Build of book openstack-network-connectivity-admin succeeded.

Change-Id: Ib5dbe41dea7512ea33fd314ca8842bc5e38cf4ba
'}]
commit_message:
Add a tiny bit more verbosity to validate.py

validate.py did not give any progress ahead of which books are going to
get build which is a bit annoying if you run it locally.

With my patch you see:
$ tools/validate.py

Following files will be validated:
>>> doc/src/docbkx/openstack-network-connectivity-admin/app_demo_routers_with_private_networks.xml

Queuing the following books for building:
  openstack-network-connectivity-admin
Building all books now...
>>> Build of book openstack-network-connectivity-admin succeeded.

Change-Id: Ib5dbe41dea7512ea33fd314ca8842bc5e38cf4ba

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-21 00:15:34.000000000', 'message': "Restore support for keystoneclient.client module

The keystoneclient.client module was renamed to
keystoneclient.httpclient with commit b7c6f604e. The rename
caused applications using keystoneclient.client to not work.

This change restores support for keystoneclient.client. It's
deprecated in favor of keystoneclient.httpclient.

Change-Id: I22e6afe59afa8567f4fc4e742f74146221de3ea4
Resolves-Bug: #1211998
"}]
commit_message:
Restore support for keystoneclient.client module

The keystoneclient.client module was renamed to
keystoneclient.httpclient with commit b7c6f604e. The rename
caused applications using keystoneclient.client to not work.

This change restores support for keystoneclient.client. It's
deprecated in favor of keystoneclient.httpclient.

Change-Id: I22e6afe59afa8567f4fc4e742f74146221de3ea4
Resolves-Bug: #1211998

commit_message:
Add a NullHandler when setting up library logging

I was gunna write a test, but mocking ImportErrors is a PITA, so I decided to
just get my tox py26 working instead.  Tests seem to fail/pass as expected
without/with the inline NullHanlder.

Closes-Bug: 1212861

Change-Id: I20207374a77ee9969ab201c3a57e4caf40c02a61

'}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-07-30 06:53:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-07-30 20:11:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Hi Gary

Could you share how to use this patch?
I have tested this with our VMware setup.
It was working well with nova-network, but 
it looks not with this patch and neutron.
(I got security group not found exception)

(1) Is that possible to use provider networking in this patch?
I would like to know the milestone of Neutron + VMWare support also.
It looks like current code didn't send VLANID to VMWare from Neutron.
It is great if this patch can create vlan bridge and setup vlan using segmentation_id

(2) How do you support security groups? (may be infuture? )
(3) How we can connection VMWare cluster and nova-compute ?

commit_message:
VMware: Ensure Neutron networking works with VMware drivers

Fixes bug 1202042

A new utility method, is_neutron, is added. This returns True
if Neutron/Quantum is used by the network_api_class.

Change-Id: Id1d1f29a02e906b98853670ea2ad589f04eba595

commit_message:
Support networks without gateway

Launching an instance when using network injection on a network
containing a subnet that has no gateway fails in scheduling with
a KeyError when using a legacy network_info provider and generates
an invalid network file for the others.

The following changes were done:

* The legacy transformer for network_info now always provides
  a gateway/gateway_v6 field, with a value of None if no gateway
  is available (this is similar to the other fields that are empty).
* The interfaces template was modified to include the gateway line
  only if a gateway is provided for the interface.

Fixes: bug #1207878
Change-Id: I887757a6bcba528059ace8831a7d23a31b08c630

commit_message:
Extracting common functionality for rpm based distros

Rather than dublicating code to implement rhel or any
other derivitive, this patch introduces an rpm-distro
element that should be used as a dependency.

Change-Id: I8a92bb041764d03f430b438f0013704f79a8674c

commit_message:
Document connecting to qemu:///system with virsh.

On redhat based systems, non-root users connect to qemu:///session by
default instead of qemu:///system.  This can by changed by setting an
environment variable.

Change-Id: I49c4a9ef024833c9715e767259119cad928d4393

commit_message:
Enable multiple translation domains for gettextutils

This change set basically addresses the review comments from change
I27640a3c8b255be51bc6396d238098bd25af61ec by allowing multiple domains'
language lists to be cached.

Also remove warning for unused import.

Change-Id: Ia5a6b5dba84c5eb6b1eae7df53fc555843630742

commit_message:
Add support for API message localization

Add support for doing language resolution for a request, based on the
Accept-Language HTTP header.

Using the lazy gettext functionality from oslo gettextutils, it is then
possible to use the resolved language to translate an exception message
to the user requested language and return that translation from the API.

Implements bp user-locale-api

Change-Id: Ia34547d618cfa6ad6458554932db710d63ef369a

I wanted to just make it clear that the sed vs. string manipulation thing is indeed just a style bikeshed at this point, and is not why I have -1'd this patch.

I do think it would make sense to establish some bash coding standards for diskimage-builder and tripleo-image-elements. Only those that could be enforced with a flake8 type program would be interesting. I do think using bash string manipulation vs. sed/awk should be the appropriate answer even in single operation steps, as it will aid in making it a habit and will aid code reviewers in spotting places where it might actually matter."}, {'account_id': 2763, 'date': '2013-08-20 12:39:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-20 12:42:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
Use kpartx if partition device doesn't exist

If the loop partition isn't created as a device by the kernel, go ahead and use
kpartx to create the device.

Change-Id: I53290b7724d0cb45a1fc9225ec096025db8978dd

commit_message:
RPC: Add support for optional message signing

Wires in SecureMessage so that signing can be optionally used.
Signing messages is always attempted but failing to create a signed message is
currently not fatal. In case of failure the message is sent unsigned.

Once all services has been converted to support signing, we can start switching
on mandatory signing.

Currently the service name needs to be a global due to the way services are
constructed.

Change-Id: Ie565bbaf61a69a4e526e78e723efecb5e2712877

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-15 17:35:34.000000000', 'message': "Enable the translation handler to be configured via logging.conf

The patch also ensures the formatter set for the translation handler is
set on the target handler too.

With this patch secondary log will be configurable declaratively in the
logging.conf, for example:

    [handlers]
    keys = secondarylog, translation

    [handler_secondarylog]
    class = handlers.WatchedFileHandlerargs = ('/oslo-localized.log',)
    formatter = context

    [handler_translation]
    class = openstack.common.log.TranslationHandler
    target = secondarylog
    args = ('zh_CN',)

Change-Id: I1c786bb0caedc0ecba23dc351f80a83d829271dd
"}]
commit_message:
Enable the translation handler to be configured via logging.conf

The patch also ensures the formatter set for the translation handler is
set on the target handler too.

With this patch secondary log will be configurable declaratively in the
logging.conf, for example:

    [handlers]
    keys = secondarylog, translation

    [handler_secondarylog]
    class = handlers.WatchedFileHandlerargs = ('/oslo-localized.log',)
    formatter = context

    [handler_translation]
    class = openstack.common.log.TranslationHandler
    target = secondarylog
    args = ('zh_CN',)

Change-Id: I1c786bb0caedc0ecba23dc351f80a83d829271dd

'}, {'account_id': 8001, 'date': '2013-08-15 20:34:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

What about existing code that used LocaleHandler?'}, {'account_id': 7996, 'date': '2013-08-16 15:25:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi John, 

I don't think anybody is using LocaleHandler inside oslo-incubator, but also in general. 

From the comments the class was delivered as an example of how to use Message. But if it is being used, references to it should be adjusted when sync'ing gettextutils to the individual projects. I don't think anybody is using it though.

Thank you,"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-08-20 20:03:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not merge

Thanks for the patches Luis.

I think it's too late to consider this for Havana at this point. The feature freeze for Oslo comes a bit earlier since features need to propagate from incubator to the individual.

Also, since this affects the widely used openstack.common.log module, I'm wary of including a new feature late in the cycle.

Please restore once we create a stable/havana branch"}, {'account_id': 7996, 'date': '2013-08-20 20:31:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Feature got deferred to Icehouse. Will restore then...'}]

commit_message:
Move LocaleHandler to log module with the rest of the log handlers

This change simply moves the LocaleHandler from gettextutils
to log, and it renames it to TranslationHandler.

Note: No functionality is added or removed in this patch, it is just
a simple refactoring in preparation for future work.

Change-Id: I6bb0c613b3f6e292acc704e010ba77ab63d0e648

commit_message:
Fix the dict type metadata missing issue

Based on current implement, the metadata with dict type will be
missed. But some metadata are using dict type, such as the extra
properties of Glance images.

Fix bug 1203699

Change-Id: Ie13e4e5231c789e0efcadace11347a15741472a1

commit_message:
Add upstream dnsmasq resolvers to dnsmasq.conf

This will allow tenants who do not specify a
DNS server in their subnet creation to add
servers for the default dnsmasq process to use
to resolve upstream

Change-Id: I99f54667b758f83d8821b97957de92b97687740c

"}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2013-08-20 17:36:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

Just a couple comments inline.

This looks like a similar commit to: 
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/42828/

We should probably stick with one review for the change to avoid missing comments in different reviews. The one that isn't going to be followed up can be 'Abandoned'. 

For the commit messages, I linked some documentation inline that is a helpful guide on what should be in a commit message. The 'recheck bug XXXXXX' part should be in the comments if the intention is to reverify or recheck a bug. The following link explains this process in more detail and is a good reference if you believe Jenkins failed and wasn't related to your change: 

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures"}, {'account_id': 7503, 'date': '2013-08-20 19:23:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

similar commit to:

[{'created': '2013-06-21 19:06:33.000000000', 'message': "Add support for live images in glance

Rather than add support for multiple potential live image formats,
just add a 'live' container type. The creator of these images will
have to use properties so that the hypervisor can identify whether
or not it can successfully boot the image.

Part of blueprint live-snapshot

Change-Id: I27a5f9837616774dfad1a3baf6c318fc0a300c71
"}, {'created': '2013-06-21 19:15:41.000000000', 'message': "Add support for live images in glance

Rather than add support for multiple potential live image formats,
just add a 'live' container type. The creator of these images will
have to use properties so that the hypervisor can identify whether
or not it can successfully boot the image.

Part of blueprint live-snapshot-vms

Change-Id: I27a5f9837616774dfad1a3baf6c318fc0a300c71
"}]
commit_message:
Add support for live images in glance

Rather than add support for multiple potential live image formats,
just add a 'live' container type. The creator of these images will
have to use properties so that the hypervisor can identify whether
or not it can successfully boot the image.

Part of blueprint live-snapshot-vms

Change-Id: I27a5f9837616774dfad1a3baf6c318fc0a300c71

Use FakeLoopingCall instead of the real one

Decrease the execution time in brick's tests.

Change-Id: Idef19e91f593c2c276015d5bf9f9cc85cd6094ad

messages:
[{'account_id': 1032, 'date': '2013-07-12 03:58:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-07-12 03:59:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but commit message has changed.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-12 04:08:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

- http://logs.openstack.org/36774/2/check/gate-ceilometer-pep8/3284 : FAILURE in 2m 13s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36774/2/check/gate-ceilometer-docs/2089 : FAILURE in 2m 51s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36774/2/check/gate-ceilometer-python26/3207 : FAILURE in 9m 15s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36774/2/check/gate-ceilometer-python27/3214 : SUCCESS in 4m 10s
"}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-07-12 12:32:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Nova has had issues with reaching a useful level of translation because the log messages introduced a large number of low priority messages into the translation system. Error messages are more important, so we should make sure we have significant coverage there before adding more messages. We may also want to wait for the "low priority" translation domain work to land in Oslo so we can use that for log messages. 

How many of our existing messages have been translated? Are 100% translated into any language?'}, {'account_id': 1032, 'date': '2013-07-16 02:19:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Doug Hellmann: Abandon?'}, {'account_id': 7138, 'date': '2013-07-22 10:03:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

No matter we should wait for log translation discussion result
in Olso or not, the code patch should pass the pep8 checking,
but it failed, pep8 shouldn't report error against "_", so I
reported a bug in the community:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+bug/1203695'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-30 06:03:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-30 06:03:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 6983, 'date': '2013-08-15 08:19:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Doug, Could you please let me know where we can get the progress of the "low priority" translation domain work to land in Oslo? any links?

Thanks in advance.
---------------------------------
Doug Hellmann		Jul 12

Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Nova has had issues with reaching a useful level of translation because the log messages introduced a large number of low priority messages into the translation system. Error messages are more important, so we should make sure we have significant coverage there before adding more messages. We may also want to wait for the "low priority" translation domain work to land in Oslo so we can use that for log messages.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-08-20 17:49:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I don't know if there's any work being done. There was a thread on the mailing list in July:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-July/011692.html"}]

commit_message:
Remove Keystone specific logging module

A unified logging implementation from Oslo-incubator has been carried
over and implemented in Keystone. This is removing the old
keystone/common/logging.py module as it is no longer needed.
Logging in Keystone is now implemented through
keystone/openstack/common/log.py and maintained through Oslo-incubator,
consistent with other logging implementations in OpenStack projects.

blueprint unified-logging-in-keystone

Change-Id: Ib9328a80f60b0b6ec7430d05077aa1a0419e05ac

Automatically re-added by Gerrit trivial rebase detection script."}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2013-07-29 14:47:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

Hey Mark - so check out the next patch in the series that gives a hint of things to come in the commit message. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/39086/

The idea behind max_locals, is that we want to enable VMs to have more local devices (as in - images on the hypervisor or shared storage) so that for example you could have instances with CD roms that come from glance. Unless we limit how many local devices are allowed - it's a nice and easy DOS vector.

This did not exist up until now as the only thing that can be created on the hypervisor is the image specified with --image on boot or a SINGLE ephemeral device."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-29 15:25:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15: Doesn't seem to work

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-28 14:20:57.000000000', 'message': 'Make API part of instance boot use new BDM format

This patch makes the API part of the instance boot process rely on the
new BDM format. It adds additional validations that are enabled due to
using the new format.

This patch also refactors and simplifies how block devices are handled
during boot, and makes sure that validation errors are caught and
transformed to expected HTTP errors.

Change-Id: I62e0807fcff0a284ff72555d107cac1c9864e46d
blueprint: improve-block-device-handling

'}, {'created': '2013-07-15 18:49:42.000000000', 'message': "Make API part of instance boot use new BDM format

This patch makes the API part of the instance boot process rely on the
new BDM format. It adds additional validations that are enabled due to
using the new format.

Since the new format will allow to specify devices that will be created
as images on the hypervisor (if the hypervisor enables it) it, in order
to prevent a DOS a new config option 'max_local_block_devices' was
added. This option allows the operator to set a limit on the number of
destination_type='local' block devices a user can specify per VM.

This patch also refactors and simplifies how block devices are handled
during boot, and makes sure that validation errors are caught and
transformed to expected HTTP errors.

Change-Id: I62e0807fcff0a284ff72555d107cac1c9864e46d
blueprint: improve-block-device-handling
"}, {'created': '2013-07-16 08:59:25.000000000', 'message': "Make API part of instance boot use new BDM format

to prevent a DOS, a new config option 'max_local_block_devices' was

This patch also refactors and simplifies how block devices are handled

as images on the hypervisor (if the hypervisor enables it), in order
to prevent a DOS, a new config option 'max_local_block_devices' was
added. This option allows the operator to set a limit on the number of
destination_type='local' block devices a user can specify per VM.

This patch also refactors and simplifies how block devices are handled
during boot, and makes sure that validation errors are caught and
transformed to expected HTTP errors.

Change-Id: I62e0807fcff0a284ff72555d107cac1c9864e46d
blueprint: improve-block-device-handling

commit_message:
Make API part of instance boot use new BDM format

This patch makes the API part of the instance boot process rely on the
new BDM format. It adds additional validations that are enabled due to
using the new format.

Since the new format will allow to specify devices that will be created
as images on the hypervisor (if the hypervisor enables it), in order
to prevent a DOS, a new config option 'max_local_block_devices' was
added. This option allows the operator to set a limit on the number of
destination_type='local' block devices a user can specify per VM.

This patch also refactors and simplifies how block devices are handled
during boot, and makes sure that validation errors are caught and
transformed to expected HTTP errors.

Change-Id: I62e0807fcff0a284ff72555d107cac1c9864e46d
blueprint: improve-block-device-handling

[{'created': '2013-08-15 22:06:03.000000000', 'message': "Use oslo's sqlalchemy layer.

Bring over the sqlalchemy layer that oslo
provides so that we can use it in a dependent
commit to replace pieces of our own mini
sqlalchemy layer (that was derived from oslos).

Change-Id: Ifda2fd5c5b8eb1d71a4cfce2a2e0046a23010270
"}, {'created': '2013-08-15 22:06:41.000000000', 'message': "Use oslo's sqlalchemy layer.

commit to replace pieces of our own mini
sqlalchemy layer (that was derived from oslos).

Change-Id: Ifda2fd5c5b8eb1d71a4cfce2a2e0046a23010270

commit_message:
Use oslo's sqlalchemy layer

Bring over the sqlalchemy layer + dependents that
oslo provides so that we can use it in a dependent
commit to replace pieces of our own mini
sqlalchemy layer (that was derived from oslos)

Change-Id: Ifda2fd5c5b8eb1d71a4cfce2a2e0046a23010270

commit_message:
File movements

In order to rework some of the persistence layer I would
like to move around some of the files first, keeping job
specifics in a jobs folder. Having some of the items which
are root level taskflow items (flow, task) be at the root
of the hiearchy. Also for now until the celery work is
commited move that, since it doesn't make sense in backends
anyway.

Change-Id: If6c149710b40f70d4ec69ee8e523defe8f5e766d

commit_message:
nova-conductor accesses database

If nova-conductor is running, it will be the only service accessing
the database.

Change-Id: I03c4da37ea461b9d6b9aa8a6933b3e3dc8d3b3b8
Closes-Bug: #1213952

commit_message:
Allow backend & client SQL tests on mysql and pg.

Currently the tables are not created which means that it isn't
possible for these tests to run on anything other than sqlite.

Fix test issues where the token id that is used to create the token is
not the same as the id that the token is saved with.

Fix a number of foreign key constraints issues.

Bug  1178041

Change-Id: Ib67eb97836e4224940abdeae4bba66748bfe4ca5

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-14 18:47:42.000000000', 'message': 'requeue instead of reject

Requeue the message instead of rejecting it. The AMQP spec
suggests reject()'ing the message to get it back in the queue.
The trick is that there is a parameter "requeue=True" required
to make this happen. Under kombu, this is done as a separate
command instead of a parameter on reject().

Change-Id: I6e820841b87eedb03318124e7d70be8da6970cc2
'}]
commit_message:
requeue instead of reject

Requeue the message instead of rejecting it. The AMQP spec
suggests reject()'ing the message to get it back in the queue.
The trick is that there is a parameter "requeue=True" required
to make this happen. Under kombu, this is done as a separate
command instead of a parameter on reject().

Change-Id: I6e820841b87eedb03318124e7d70be8da6970cc2

commit_message:
Support rejection of messages

Now that we can requeue messages, there is a chance
of having duplicates. This branch allows us to
reject messages we have seen before.

Change-Id: I43d47c2c8e03518221a17a2e9b0f342aa490e1bb
