[{'account_id': 159, 'date': '2013-07-18 18:44:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

These are private methods. Nothing outside this library should be using these callbacks.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-18 18:58:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/37741/1/check/gate-oslo-incubator-pep8/2538 : SUCCESS in 1m 44s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/37741/1/check/gate-oslo-incubator-docs/2313/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 43s
- http://logs.openstack.org/37741/1/check/gate-oslo-incubator-pyflakes/2162 : SUCCESS in 1m 40s
- http://logs.openstack.org/37741/1/check/gate-oslo-incubator-python26/2497 : SUCCESS in 3m 26s
- http://logs.openstack.org/37741/1/check/gate-oslo-incubator-python27/2498 : SUCCESS in 2m 33s
'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2013-07-19 23:50:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(6 inline comments)

Overall I like the idea, but I do have a few suggestions.  My inline comments can be pretty much summed up by the following:

I would like the see the callback re-raise the exception (all of sys.exc_info) instead of just returning it, so we don't lose the stack trace.  That should actually simplify the error handling a bit too.

Technically I think this should be two separate changes too, although I guess the delivery_info change is pretty small.  Just wanted to mention it."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-07-22 21:59:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The conclusion I thought the thread came to was that this callback signature is internal to the qpid and kombu drivers

Could you explain how the callback signature is part of the public API and cause problems for users outside oslo-incubator?

For reference, the thread is http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-July/thread.html#12138"}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2013-07-29 14:05:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@mark. Ceilometer uses the internal amqp-based api's and not the external rpc api (which is quite vague on consumers).  Not sure if we want to tackle exposing this now or push until rpc.messaging (which would be my preference). 

Just back from vacation, so I'll have a look at the ramifications of all this.

@ben ... makes sense. I think I can do something with that. Debated it myself. Though the stacktrace will still be maintained within the exception anyway. Stay tuned."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-07-29 14:22:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I thought we had removed all uses of internal APIs in ceilometer. Did we miss one?'}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2013-07-29 14:29:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@doug, https://github.com/openstack/ceilometer/blob/master/ceilometer/collector/service.py#L176 is specific to amqp.py and not really exposed at the abstracted layer. 

I need to see if create_worker is amqp-specific also https://github.com/openstack/ceilometer/blob/master/ceilometer/collector/service.py#L160'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-07-29 14:33:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

That method is the one I added to the public API to avoid us using private methods. See https://github.com/openstack/oslo-incubator/blob/master/openstack/common/rpc/common.py#L226

The zmq driver may not implement it, but Eric and I discussed the arguments to the API in depth to try to ensure that it could when we got to it.'}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2013-07-29 14:40:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@doug, yup, I think I just missed a parameter on common.py when I originally did my ack_on_error changes. I'll dig a little deeper. Shouldn't be a big issue."}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2013-07-30 15:34:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-30 15:39:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

(3 inline comments)

I like this version better.  A few comments on the test cases inline.

Also, it looks like all callbacks will now have to handle kwargs.  From the commit message I am led to believe that we are trying to maintain compatibility with existing callbacks, but it looks like they may have to be modified.  That's not necessarily a problem, but I want to be clear about the intent here."}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2013-08-05 19:55:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Thanks Ben ... line 238 in common.py I mention that people should support **kwargs to future proof the callback, but it's optional and the patch maintains backwards compatibility. 

Patch with your other suggestions on its way."}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2013-08-05 20:17:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-05 20:22:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2013-08-05 23:45:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Okay, so for the moment we're not passing kwargs and everything's good.  If we started passing kwargs to the callback we would get errors from any that didn't include kwargs, which is the reason for the comment recommending that any new callbacks support it.  Think I've got it.

Just +1 for now because some of the earlier discussion kind of went over my head and I want to make sure those people get a chance to look at it again.  I can revisit in the future though."}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2013-08-06 00:29:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-08-13 22:29:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(4 inline comments)

As I say inline, I think there's maybe 5 separate patches here

Let's put the delivery_info stuff aside for now - that requires a bunch of discussion about how to make the delivery_info not rabbit (or even amqp) specific. I include "add **kwargs to all callbacks" as part of the delivery info stuff.

The main thing here is about allowing some consumers to not ack the message until the message has been fully processed

In oslo.messaging, we don't actually spawn a greenthread directly from the callback - instead, we just add the message to a list and return it to the caller which spawns off a greenthread. So, things are going to be very different there. I'd also model this via a notification consumers API, since that's the use case we know about for this.

As for this _wait_for_consumers ugliness - why not just pass the flag to the CallbackWrapper constructor?

Also, if ack_on_error=False why does CallbackWrapper spawn off a greenthread at all - why not just invoke the callback in the current thread?'}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2013-08-14 17:16:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Work In Progress

Splitting this into smaller branches.'}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2013-08-20 15:32:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Abandoned

broken into smaller changes'}]

commit_message:
Don't eat callback exceptions and preserve delivery_info

In order to preserve backwards compatibility with existing
callbacks (that may live outside of this library) the
delivery_info and signaling flag is passed in the message
payload.

The implication of catching the exceptions in the callback
is that we have to wait for all the consumers to return.
That is, we lose async on the callbacks. Fortunately, this
is only for the consumers that don't want ack_on_error
behavior.

delivery_info is additional message info included in the
message, but was getting dropped previously. This info is
useful to some consumers (like Ceilometer).

Change-Id: I0a7f590d9bdbc158403b7212619a276c44e945f7

commit_message:
Package api_audit_map.conf

The api_audit_map.conf file was not being packaged as a data file by pbr
since it wasn't listed as a data file in setup.cfg. This is needed for
packaging python-cadf in an rpm.

Closes-Bug: #1214407

Change-Id: I126cd10cb2904cdedc91f719dc1d5a96110bcad1

thanks!"}, {'account_id': 8403, 'date': '2013-08-09 11:46:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2013-08-09 12:19:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This will fail pep8 I think.
Also checking for "/" is a bit coupled/redundant
Also the 2 messages are a bit redundant
Also no point checking subsequent mount errors if the first "root" one fails. so how about:

        # the root directory must be mounted first
        mounts.sort(key=lambda mount: mount[0])

        root_mounted = False 
        for mount in mounts:    
            LOG.debug(_("Mounting %(dev)s at %(dir)s") %        
                      {'dev': mount[1], 'dir': mount[0]})       
            try:
                self.handle.mount_options("", mount[1], mount[0])
                root_mounted = True
            except RuntimeError as e:
                msg = _("Error mounting %(device)s to %(dir)s in image"
                        " %(imgfile)s with libguestfs (%(e)s)") %
                      {'imgfile': self.imgfile, 'device': mount[1],
                       'dir': mount[0], 'e': e})
                if root_mounted:
                    LOG.debug(msg)
                else
                    raise exception.NovaException(msg)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-09 12:32:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
fix libguestfs mount order when inspecting

variable `mounts` sorted value is
[
    ('/boot', '/dev/vda1'),
    ('/', '/dev/vda2'),
    ('/var', '/dev/vda5'),
    ('/home', '/dev/vda6'),
    ('/home/q', '/dev/vda7')
]
but `/boot` directory is in `/` partition.

Fixes: Bug #1210371
Change-Id: I3d9cd59237bc4fc277415104c9170d2e372a1c25

commit_message:
Merge ch_computescheduler.xml to computescheduler.xml

As a first step in resolving bug 1212862 which states that
/openstack-compute-admin/computescheduler.xml and
/openstack-config/ch_computescheduler.xml should have the same
content, I'll merge all changes done to ch_computescheduler.xml to
computescheduler.xml.

This patch merges the following commits:
    clean-up of 'common' dir in openstack-manuals (remove unused files
and use common naming convention)
    Change-Id: I3e0f03ac42c39a2ed3fed2d530beb61f6b81873c
----
    Adds link to block storage page from config and admin scheduler
pages. Also fixes missed update to admin scheduler page from
bug-1192627,
    Change-Id: Ie33d039a3f668215d32e18edb8b5b3bea71b9aa6
----
    bug 1188522, author sean roberts, removed reference to volume
scheduler in ch_computescheduler.xml

    Change-Id: Ie26b1b8814a169e79ebbdcbde8579e5aa820a823
----

Change-Id: I668a7c54c7e237b3989e44b6745e940d080abbfe
Partial-Bug: #1212862

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-20 14:20:20.000000000', 'message': 'Remove use_greenlets argument to MongoClient

use_greenlets causes gevent to be needed. As per the docs:

"If you need to use standard Python threads in the same process as
Gevent and greenlets, run monkey.patch_socket(), rather than
monkey.patch_all(), and create a MongoClient with use_greenlets=True.
The MongoClient will use a special greenlet-aware connection pool."

We do not use threads, so it seems like we're doing extra complexity
without needing it right now. Also, gevent is not python3 or pypy
compatible, so we'd be bringing in a dependency that would make things
harder moving forward.

Change-Id: I7cd2f5958fdef585cd515c8b1b7ae9fb62c26980
'}]
commit_message:
Remove use_greenlets argument to MongoClient

use_greenlets causes gevent to be needed. As per the docs:

"If you need to use standard Python threads in the same process as
Gevent and greenlets, run monkey.patch_socket(), rather than
monkey.patch_all(), and create a MongoClient with use_greenlets=True.
The MongoClient will use a special greenlet-aware connection pool."

We do not use threads, so it seems like we're doing extra complexity
without needing it right now. Also, gevent is not python3 or pypy
compatible, so we'd be bringing in a dependency that would make things
harder moving forward.

Change-Id: I7cd2f5958fdef585cd515c8b1b7ae9fb62c26980

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-19 18:53:57.000000000', 'message': 'Allow Parameters to set defaults for TemplateResource

Although it is theoretically possible to infer default values for the
Properties of a TemplateResource from the Parameters of the provider
template, this presents a number of conversion issues that are presently
unhandled.

Instead, pass parameter values only for properties that are supplied.  For
the others, allow the parameter defaults in the template to be used.

Change-Id: I2ba49ffeee06c3a272694c18b3875f843ade1e6c
'}]
commit_message:
Allow Parameters to set defaults for TemplateResource

Although it is theoretically possible to infer default values for the
Properties of a TemplateResource from the Parameters of the provider
template, this presents a number of conversion issues that are presently
unhandled.

Instead, pass parameter values only for properties that are supplied.  For
the others, allow the parameter defaults in the template to be used.

Change-Id: I2ba49ffeee06c3a272694c18b3875f843ade1e6c

commit_message:
Demote personalities from core of API v3 as extensions os-personality

This patch move 'personality' from core into extensions.
* demote personality the attribute of server from servers
* add corresponding tests
* move some tests about personality from test_servers to test_personality

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: I62254a94476271b1d8bcc206dfda1236f155960b

commit_message:
Fix markup of app_demo_routers_with_private_networks.xml

My changes are mainly:
* use userinput instead of computeroutput as appropriate
* add prompts
* use programlisting (language="bash" only used for bash code)
* use filename

I also followed Diane's editorial suggestion rewording the initial
setup description.

Change-Id: I9bb53a93336e599dcd9d9426d7d821daf569611a

commit_message:
Fix response style in limits API-v3

Replaced camel case attribute names by underscore separated ones before get
limits tests to api-v3 on tempest.

Change-Id: I63764c17be6c1429396261ebd7c7463b2c2701bd

"}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2013-07-29 15:36:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

After reading the blueprint wiki I would personally like to see more of how this will be used in actual code before giving it a thumbs up. (to avoid bit rot, and also there is a debate going on about how to present data to the scheduler that touches on this briefly).

I would like to see at least a proposal of how this can be enforced by the hypervisor."}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2013-08-02 11:46:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Migration 204 is now taken."}, {'account_id': 7461, 'date': '2013-08-07 12:32:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7461, 'date': '2013-08-07 12:45:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Nikola Thank you for your comment and I will add some information to the bp wiki. As it stands this change only introduces the tracking of network bandwidth, it is not meant to do the enforcement. In fact we can use it as it is. 

In order to access to some other parameters we need, our compute nodes fetch the flavor and other information in scripts that set up the virtualization. One implementation we have in place is to use cgroups to limit network bandwidth. In that case this patch is sufficient to implement the compute node functions needed to account for the resource consumption. The enforcement is completely decoupled and no new api is needed here to pass the information.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-07 13:29:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-26 16:28:00.000000000', 'message': "Make bandwidth allocation visible to scheduler

The scheduler and the compute nodes currently keep track of disk,
memory and vcpu resource allocation. This includes reporting available
and allocated resource values, accounting for their consumption in the
scheduler's HostState class and gating acceptance of new instances at
the compute node in the Claims and ResourceTracker classes. It should
be noted that these are used to manage static resource allocation. They
are not dynamic resource utilization metrics.

Network bandwidth is added to this list to allow the scheduler to be
aware of network allocation at the hosts. This will support the ability
to avoid over-committing network resources at a host.

This is part of: blueprint network-bandwidth-entitlement

Change-Id: Ief204b0f96a5bad9e7d07eb7bda6505ca67ad76d
"}, {'created': '2013-08-07 12:32:32.000000000', 'message': "Make bandwidth allocation visible to scheduler

The scheduler and the compute nodes currently keep track of disk,
memory and vcpu resource allocation. This includes reporting available
and allocated resource values, accounting for their consumption in the
scheduler's HostState class and gating acceptance of new instances at
the compute node in the Claims and ResourceTracker classes. It should

commit_message:
Make bandwidth allocation visible to scheduler

The scheduler and the compute nodes currently keep track of disk,
memory and vcpu resource allocation. This includes reporting available
and allocated resource values, accounting for their consumption in the
scheduler's HostState class and gating acceptance of new instances at
the compute node in the Claims and ResourceTracker classes. It should
be noted that these are used to manage static resource allocation. They
are not dynamic resource utilization metrics.

Network bandwidth is added to this list to allow the scheduler to be
aware of network allocation at the hosts. This will support the ability
to avoid over-committing network resources at a host.

This is part of: blueprint network-bandwidth-entitlement

Change-Id: Ief204b0f96a5bad9e7d07eb7bda6505ca67ad76d

commit_message:
Port disk_config API to v3 Part 2

This patch contains the changes required to adapt the agent
extension and the corresponding unittest to the v3 framework.
Moves the commented out tests from the v3 version of test_servers
to the user data extension unittests.

Partially implements: bp v3-api-extension-versioning
Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: I7eef3ba18d7cc36c1ef78d093f50fd9122ac26c7

commit_message:
Offer a paginated version of flavor_get_all

Implements nova.compute.flavors.get_all_flavors_sorted_list to
optimise get_all_flavors.

Fixes: bug #1028494
Change-Id: Ie0406c1d4b47a51473979910c0908b153497d503

commit_message:
Adding metadata checking to image location proxy layer

Enable image locaton proxy checking metadata when the location changing.
Implemented bp: location-proxy-metadata-checking

Change-Id: If411a454cd2c3e277ea9840cc3d83ec5125bb372
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-19 21:12:32.000000000', 'message': "Raise timeout in fake RPC if no consumers found

If you do a call() with e.g. the kombu driver, and there is no consumer
listening, then you will get a Timeout exception.

However, with the fake driver, we just silently return None in this
case. The oslo.messaging fake driver instead raises a Timeout and this
behaviour change turned up a tonne of issues with Nova's unit tests.

Make this change here too so that we can merge fixes for Nova's tests
before porting to oslo.messaging.

Note that although we also raise a Timeout in the case of cast(), but
cast() then just ignores the exception.

I'd add a test for this, but it appears we don't have any unit tests for
the fake driver.

Change-Id: Id14534ea5aff4ab2a27d31ca6f0ad2f2a8d273c8
"}]
commit_message:
Raise timeout in fake RPC if no consumers found

If you do a call() with e.g. the kombu driver, and there is no consumer
listening, then you will get a Timeout exception.

However, with the fake driver, we just silently return None in this
case. The oslo.messaging fake driver instead raises a Timeout and this
behaviour change turned up a tonne of issues with Nova's unit tests.

Make this change here too so that we can merge fixes for Nova's tests
before porting to oslo.messaging.

Note that although we also raise a Timeout in the case of cast(), but
cast() then just ignores the exception.

I'd add a test for this, but it appears we don't have any unit tests for
the fake driver.

Change-Id: Id14534ea5aff4ab2a27d31ca6f0ad2f2a8d273c8

commit_message:
Use functools.wrap() instead of custom implementation

In openstack.db.sqlalchemy.session.py:_wrap_db_err() we used
custom implementation of functools.wrap(). So this patch remove
custom implementation and use functools.wrap().

Closes-Bug: #1119726

Change-Id: Ic92658647bc37d81a819581128fec675ad545c4a

subject: Add per-owner number of images limit
messages:
[{'account_id': 455, 'date': '2013-08-15 13:08:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This is kind of a work in progress, but interested in feedback on the approach.'}, {'account_id': 4463, 'date': '2013-08-15 13:55:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The concern here is empty image records filling up db vs actual image creations? Because if later we can get quotas to cover that.'}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2013-08-15 14:02:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hey Iccha!

Which quotas do you mean? (Hoping that's not a really dumb question!)"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-15 14:15:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/22/42122/1/check/gate-glance-pep8/5c9e80a : SUCCESS in 1m 54s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/22/42122/1/check/gate-glance-docs/fb62213/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 2m 47s
- http://logs.openstack.org/22/42122/1/check/gate-glance-python26/5d5334f : SUCCESS in 10m 57s
- http://logs.openstack.org/22/42122/1/check/gate-glance-python27/720032e : SUCCESS in 8m 52s
- http://logs.openstack.org/22/42122/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/10f33bc : SUCCESS in 40m 24s
- http://logs.openstack.org/22/42122/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-cells-full/51af347 : FAILURE in 13m 43s (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/22/42122/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-testr-full/29f2b64 : SUCCESS in 28m 50s (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/22/42122/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/2968522 : SUCCESS in 43m 04s
- http://logs.openstack.org/22/42122/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-neutron/7000381 : SUCCESS in 19m 07s
- http://logs.openstack.org/22/42122/1/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/6b6cbcb : SUCCESS in 21m 53s
'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2013-08-16 15:11:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Similar concern like iccha. Now jbresnah is working on th bp iccha mentioned, you can track it by this link: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/glance/+spec/glance-basic-quotas
The difference is he is working on image bytes, and your patch is working on image number. So I would like to see this patch can align with that BP. 

This is a good work. Sorry for the blocking."}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2013-08-16 20:44:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Fei Long Wang,

Thanks for the pointer to the quotas blueprint.

I've sent John a pointer to this patch. It
may provide a starting point for his efforts
on a quota for number of images."}, {'account_id': 6493, 'date': '2013-08-17 18:02:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This is a good feature!  It seems inline with the simple quotas blueprint that I am working on.

There are a couple of things that concern me with this patch.  You are handling the enforcement in the DB layer.  I am not sure that this is the best place (tho I could potentially be convinced).  Originally in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/37993/ I was doing the enforcement in the same place but I eventually decided not to.  The problem is that in order to get to the DB you may go through several layers.  From the API to the registry server to the DB for example.  We should discuss this in the next glance meeting on Thursday.

The second is that if you do put this in the db API you should probably have an implementation for all dbs (in this case the simple db would need to be included).

I also would like the db to raise a different type of exception and then have that exception caught in both v1 and v2 and converted to an http exception."}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-08-19 22:05:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I think applying quotas closer to the db is the right approach, but unfortunately we don't have a good enough model to support that in the right way. Doing this enforcement directly in the sqlalchemy driver is just not going to work."}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2013-08-20 11:45:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Three '-1s' ... I can take a hint ;-)

A different approach is clearly warranted.

Hopefully this patch was at least useful in identifying
what we don't want. :-)
 
I'll keep an eye out for the image count limit part of the quotas blueprint."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-15 13:07:50.000000000', 'message': "Add per-owner number of images limit

Add 'image_count_cap' parameter which limits the number
of images that a particular owner can create.

The thinking here is to prevent a runaway script from
unintentionally filling up the database.

Change-Id: Ibee764e4a23435ea4cb32f6cb50762f6d96a3ead
"}]
commit_message:
Add per-owner number of images limit

Add 'image_count_cap' parameter which limits the number
of images that a particular owner can create.

The thinking here is to prevent a runaway script from
unintentionally filling up the database.

Change-Id: Ibee764e4a23435ea4cb32f6cb50762f6d96a3ead

[{'created': '2013-08-08 09:29:16.000000000', 'message': "Don't add the %interface with ipv6 in whataremyips.

- Since netifaces is appending a %interface (i.e: %eth0) at the end and
  does not make a correct ipv6 address we are removing it.
- Improve the tests of whataremyips along the way.

Closes-Bug: 1209443
Change-Id: I585e795083783009961b429607ca3f66b8d7ec30
"}, {'created': '2013-08-08 09:42:20.000000000', 'message': "Don't append %interface with ipv6 ips.

- Since netifaces is appending a %interface (i.e: %eth0) at the end and
  does not make a correct ipv6 address we are removing it.
- Improve the tests of whataremyips along the way.

Closes-Bug: 1209443
Change-Id: I585e795083783009961b429607ca3f66b8d7ec30
"}]
commit_message:
Don't append %interface with ipv6 ips.

- Since netifaces is appending a %interface (i.e: %eth0) at the end and
  does not make a correct ipv6 address we are removing it.
- Improve the tests of whataremyips along the way.

Closes-Bug: 1209443
Change-Id: I585e795083783009961b429607ca3f66b8d7ec30

commit_message:
Remove non-baremetal flavors in setup-baremetal.

Currently it's impossible to mix baremetal and non-baremetal
hypervisors. We could leave the flavors intact, but that just makes it
possible for users to shoot themselves in the foot trying to boot
instances on them.

Change-Id: I7f60d0449f2881702574527c8ddb34526aaea8f4

commit_message:
Register API endpoints from outside the clouds.

Another step in our principled separation, this adds a small wrapper
to register-endpoint to register all the endpoints for a control
plane.

Change-Id: I803cb37625051f5e20cb75e04c6c2e7a1c6a1e23

commit_message:
Add helper script to register endpoints.

Endpoint registration is something we should be managing via APIs
rather than in-instance scripts becausemachines often don't know their
externally visible addresses, and APIs are often behind haproxy or
other proxies.

Change-Id: I26c59fc069cb57146e7ebb7c19b70c1ce0e77a01

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-08 14:55:07.000000000', 'message': "Use single meta when change column type

Function _change_deleted_column_type_to_boolean_sqlite() from module
openstack.common.db.sqlalchemy.utils uses get_table() function to get
required Table object. Function get_table() creates a MetaData object and
returns the Table instance using this metadata. When function
`_change_deleted_column_type_to_boolean_sqlite` creates new table, it
also create new MetaData() objects.
It's works fine in most cases, but when table has foreign key, there is
no possibility to find related table for new table because related table
absent in new metadata.

To fix this issue we get metadata from received Table object.
Test added.

Fixes bug 1210163

Change-Id: I9c441d263e6e87fce702b12f5d2c4a9144cfb7e4
"}]
commit_message:
Use single meta when change column type

Function _change_deleted_column_type_to_boolean_sqlite() from module
openstack.common.db.sqlalchemy.utils uses get_table() function to get
required Table object. Function get_table() creates a MetaData object and
returns the Table instance using this metadata. When function
`_change_deleted_column_type_to_boolean_sqlite` creates new table, it
also create new MetaData() objects.
It's works fine in most cases, but when table has foreign key, there is
no possibility to find related table for new table because related table
absent in new metadata.

To fix this issue we get metadata from received Table object.
Test added.

Fixes bug 1210163

Change-Id: I9c441d263e6e87fce702b12f5d2c4a9144cfb7e4

[{'created': '2013-08-19 21:06:30.000000000', 'message': "Standardize on ID for log messages

We have some places where logs use name to identify
a volume and others where we use ID.  Let's standardize
on the UUID here as that's typically the unique identifier
we use in most places anyway.  Even though name is a
derviative it seems better to be consistent with this
and use the UUID by itself.

Change-Id: Iaee3d146042780e4a526834db1e0be84a705f24b
Fixes: bug 1214140
"}]
commit_message:
Standardize on ID for log messages

We have some places where logs use name to identify
a volume and others where we use ID.  Let's standardize
on the UUID here as that's typically the unique identifier
we use in most places anyway.  Even though name is a
derviative it seems better to be consistent with this
and use the UUID by itself.

Change-Id: Iaee3d146042780e4a526834db1e0be84a705f24b
Fixes: bug 1214140

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-19 18:33:10.000000000', 'message': "Reduce hidden effects of sqlalchemy objects

The flows are currently holding onto sqlalchemy
due to bug #1214083 and this is causing a problem
with gettextutils which appears to be deepcopying
the raw objects, of which one of those is sqlalchemy
objects, which can't seem to be deepcopied.

Change-Id: Ie831738799a75e2a4a652c73900cad353a71e327
"}]
commit_message:
Reduce hidden effects of sqlalchemy objects

The flows are currently holding onto sqlalchemy
due to bug #1214083 and this is causing a problem
with gettextutils which appears to be deepcopying
the raw objects, of which one of those is sqlalchemy
objects, which can't seem to be deepcopied.

Change-Id: Ie831738799a75e2a4a652c73900cad353a71e327

[{'created': '2013-08-20 00:02:20.000000000', 'message': "Use LONGTEXT for templates in MySQL

TEXT in PostgreSQL is an unlimited column size. However, in MySQL, it is
limited to 2^16 bytes. LONGTEXT allows 2^32 bytes, which is overkill,
but will prevent MySQL from silently truncating this column and thus
rendering the entire tenant's API access moot.

Fixes bug #1210799

Change-Id: Ib2b379db32a8296cf8c5a2434e7615afc59288e3
"}, {'created': '2013-08-20 00:38:50.000000000', 'message': "Use LONGTEXT for templates in MySQL

"}, {'created': '2013-08-20 03:13:53.000000000', 'message': "Use LONGTEXT for templates in MySQL

TEXT in PostgreSQL is an unlimited column size. However, in MySQL, it is
limited to 2^16 bytes. LONGTEXT allows 2^32 bytes, which is overkill,
but will prevent MySQL from silently truncating this column and thus
rendering the entire tenant's API access moot.

Fixes bug #1210799

Change-Id: Ib2b379db32a8296cf8c5a2434e7615afc59288e3

commit_message:
Use LONGTEXT for templates in MySQL

TEXT in PostgreSQL is an unlimited column size. However, in MySQL, it is
limited to 2^16 bytes. LONGTEXT allows 2^32 bytes, which is overkill,
but will prevent MySQL from silently truncating this column and thus
rendering the entire tenant's API access moot.

Fixes bug #1210799

Change-Id: Ib2b379db32a8296cf8c5a2434e7615afc59288e3

commit_message:
Stop registering endpoints in-instance.

We're moving to orchestrating APIs externally. The incubator has a
patch set pending to perform endpoint registration, which can be used
when this is merged.

Change-Id: I8b25e469d23a9a369c1278377fb64291a0cec6c0

commit_message:
Set file permission to be executable.

When ramdisk-image-create is called with the hwdiscovery element,
it failed to install hwinfo package.

The root reason is 10-hwinfo is not executable, the fix is to
set the file permission of 10-hwinfo to be executable.

Change-Id: I3a57147103f607b3975eb6ad23a44475f26c2f1e

@Derek I like the idea of just making this depend on openstack-client element'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-08-18 01:38:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

why have assorted source-repository files and not one central file? for all elements (would live in source-repository element)'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-08-18 01:38:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Very good point, although we can end up with two elements requiring the same source-repository but using different sources for it which *could* be out of sync.  An annoying problem to debug.'}, {'account_id': 1926, 'date': '2013-08-18 01:38:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Because each element knows what repository it needs. We can't simply name all repositories in the source-repo element there is no way of knowing what elements it will be used with."}, {'account_id': 1926, 'date': '2013-08-18 01:38:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Joe, yes this would be annoying, but elements shouldn't place repositories to the same path, and the source-repositories elements doesn't allow this to happen as it errors if the target directory already exists.

@lifeless, I think maybe it would be better (and simpler) to have this element maybe just depend on openstack-clients? I'm trying not to split it out as a special case, we shouldn't have to treat it differently to any other client."}, {'account_id': 4190, 'date': '2013-08-18 01:38:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I think it would be better to split the neutronclient repo definition out of openstack-clients into it's own element, with a dep on that from both openstack-clients and neutron."}, {'account_id': 1926, 'date': '2013-08-19 21:30:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Restored

So looks like neutronclient is no longer needed here, @lifeless would you be open to just removing it alltogether?

Currently boot-seed-vm creates a new image each time it is run, users
who want to restart a new identical seed VM shouldn't need to create it
again from scratch a second time.

This commit gives users the option to cache the seed image so it can be
reused again without a costly call to di-b to create a new one.

commit_message:
Add caching ability to boot-seed-vm

Currently boot-seed-vm creates a new image each time it is run, users
who want to restart a new identical seed VM shouldn't need to create it
again from scratch a second time.

This commit gives users the option to cache the seed image so it can be
reused again without a costly call to di-b to create a new one.

Change-Id: Ib8174227cf6e16ae59a64ef396b6a3c5f125be4e

'}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2013-08-02 15:14:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-08-13 22:12:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi!

While I want to make the cinderclient dependency a soft failure (or not a failure) in the typical case, I'm worried this change will cause problems for deployers who specifically turn the cinder store on--in particular, will they be sufficiently notified, and at the right time (as early as possible) that cinderclient is not available?

What happens with this patch if cinder is not present and your cloud has an image from the cinder store?"}, {'account_id': 6493, 'date': '2013-08-14 07:53:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

It seems to me that if the plug in is distributed with glance, and installed via glance setup.py, that all of its dependencies should be requirements.

The core issue here may be that we do not have a good framework for adding additional storage system plug ins.  I would like to see a 'contrib' directory (or something like that).  This could be full of optional plugins with there own setup.py and set of requirements.  These could then optionally be installed, but when installed the operator would know that they had everything they need to work.

I realize that this is longer term work thus the -1 instead of the -2.  Perhaps in the short term something like this makes some sense.  I will defer to the communities thoughts."}, {'account_id': 1926, 'date': '2013-08-17 21:03:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

In the sort term this commit fixes the immediate problem and follows the pattern used in other storage backends i.e. disable backend if dependencies arn't available. So I don't see any problem with merging it in. Although not being a regular glance contributor I may be missing something somewhere."}, {'account_id': 6493, 'date': '2013-08-17 23:33:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I actually do not see how this disables cinder either.  It seems that this would allow it to be loaded but if it would still be in the table of available drivers.  If it were ever used I would expect a 'NameError'.  I see that swift does a similar thing which also appears to me to be wrong.  Perhaps someone else can clear this up?  Note that gridfs appears to be handling this situation correctly.

However, I am also confused as to why this would ever happen in a properly installed glanced service.  python-cinderclient is in the requirements.txt file."}, {'account_id': 1926, 'date': '2013-08-19 13:59:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks John your last comment cleared this up for me, the problem was packaging didn't yet include the dependency from requirments.txt

https://github.com/redhat-openstack/openstack-glance/commit/d6b5292a13ab99bf066546c966546020a7699bdd"}, {'account_id': 1926, 'date': '2013-08-20 08:17:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

abandoning, fixed in packaging'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-01 20:30:55.000000000', 'message': "Don't fail if cinderclient doesn't exist

Wrapping the import of cinder client so that if it doesn't exist then
glance can continue to startup.

Change-Id: I25df58e990595c3869a8967f3d2c9107159c92b4
"}]
commit_message:
Don't fail if cinderclient doesn't exist

Wrapping the import of cinder client so that if it doesn't exist then
glance can continue to startup.

Change-Id: I25df58e990595c3869a8967f3d2c9107159c92b4

This patch breaks metaplugin,
but it will be fixed in your next patch.

so I tend to prefer merge to patch for one.
But separate two patch is also OK.'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-08-09 09:38:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Nachi, I though about it too, but how can that happen?
_DB_ENGINE is pretty much an unused variable at this stage.
The engine is now in neutron.openstack.common.db.session

If you tell where metaplugin is broken I can fix it here.
That's the reason why I kept this patch in wip"}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-08-19 12:51:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Ready For Review

I am putting these patches out of WIP - I will discuss with Nachi how to deal with metaplugin'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2013-08-19 15:02:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Your next patch will fix metaplugin also.
Instead of clearing DB_ENGINE, we don't recreate sql schema.
Reaction of sql schema is needed because the db schemas of which each plugin requests may be different.

However your next patch will remove db creation from neutron, so it should be no problem."}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-08-20 04:00:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

commit_message:
Remove global DB_ENGINE from Neutron

Related-Bug 1207402

This global is not used anymore as it's been replaced by a similar
global variable in neutron/openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/session.py

Change-Id: Id4614069af490020d18f14011853787930076e0a

commit_message:
Make auth_token middleware fetching respect prefix

In auth_token middleware auth_prefix is only added to requests that go
through the _json_request method. This doesn't include the two
certificate fetching functions. Manually add the auth_prefix to both
those requests.

Closes-Bug: #1211615
Change-Id: I25d1b401598c9a443ddef0fc3259ba859aee8c76

subject: Minor changes to keep Puppet2.6 compatibility
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 1918, 'name': 'Franois Charlier', 'email': 'francois.charlier@redhat.com', 'username': 'francois-charlier'}, {'_account_id': 2265, 'name': 'Dan Bode', 'email': 'bodepd@gmail.com', 'username': 'bodepd'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 5241, 'name': 'Martin Magr', 'email': 'mmagr@redhat.com', 'username': 'mmagr'}, {'_account_id': 7156, 'name': 'Mathieu Gagn', 'email': 'mgagne@calavera.ca', 'username': 'mgagne'}, {'_account_id': 7822, 'name': 'Chris Hoge (not involved in upstream development)', 'email': 'chris@hogepodge.com', 'username': 'hogepodge'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 2265, 'date': '2013-08-16 17:10:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

As an FYI, we disabled the Puppet 2.6.x tests over 2 months ago after an agrreement that it would not longer be supported.'}, {'account_id': 7156, 'date': '2013-08-16 18:13:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not merge

Puppet 2.6 is EOL and we do not support Puppet 2.6 anymore.

Please upgrade to a supported version.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-16 18:15:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/81/42381/1/check/gate-puppet-ceilometer-puppet-lint/3692cae : SUCCESS in 7s
- http://logs.openstack.org/81/42381/1/check/gate-puppet-ceilometer-puppet-syntax/b545fc8 : SUCCESS in 7s
- http://logs.openstack.org/81/42381/1/check/gate-puppet-ceilometer-puppet-unit-2.7/0ca6ea2 : SUCCESS in 1m 04s
- http://logs.openstack.org/81/42381/1/check/gate-puppet-ceilometer-puppet-unit-3.0/45e5eb8 : SUCCESS in 48s
- http://logs.openstack.org/81/42381/1/check/gate-puppet-ceilometer-puppet-unit-3.1/2114fc0 : SUCCESS in 50s
'}, {'account_id': 7822, 'date': '2013-08-16 18:30:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

More a comment on EPEL than dropping support for 2.6. As long as EPEL refuses to move kicking and screaming into the future there's going to be a demand for 2.6 support."}, {'account_id': 7822, 'date': '2013-08-16 22:28:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'll also say that 2.6 is officially unsupported, and I think that should be our policy also."}, {'account_id': 5241, 'date': '2013-08-19 08:05:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

It's just a few commas removal to make the module work for 2.6 also. If this is such a big issue for future(present) releases I guess I will have to fork, because I cannot upgrade yet unfortunately."}, {'account_id': 7156, 'date': '2013-08-19 21:07:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Unless we test our modules against Puppet 2.6, it will be a catch-up game as we have no policy enforcing trailing commas and such minor things.

Furthermore, we already had a discussion about Puppet 2.6 support on our list:
https://groups.google.com/a/puppetlabs.com/forum/#!topic/puppet-openstack/o3nmsl54UQE
https://groups.google.com/a/puppetlabs.com/forum/#!msg/puppet-openstack/qdp-7rPNy8g/hWgPzBLTQvYJ
https://groups.google.com/a/puppetlabs.com/forum/#!msg/puppet-openstack/TbjpWasf0as/AjNaJuJts-wJ

RedHat folks did not see any major problem in that aspect and did not voiced their objections when Puppet 2.6 support drop was announced.

It has been 3 months since we dropped it and IMO, work should have been started and completed since.

We won't waste time reviewing changes for an EOL Puppet version anymore. Thanks for your understanding."}, {'account_id': 5241, 'date': '2013-08-20 07:47:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned'}]

Change-Id: I33645edbc6d24f5f7cd0a9364bb8d484b1d78843
'}]

Sorry for the inconvenient.
If you want to see Henry's comment, you can find it in 'Patch Set 1'"}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2013-08-13 08:18:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

So the REST API is the definitive specification (as defined in the Identity-api specification document).  Various clients (including the cli client) can chose to implement some subset of it (or to restrict operations) in ways that are appropriate to their usage.  So I don't think it is correct to say "we should implement xyz in the server because the cli client does things a certain way".  As long as we consider default project a part of the spec, we should support it properly - and so the bug is that we don't include the right code in the server when the default project id is updated.'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2013-08-13 08:19:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2013-08-13 08:21:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

In line comment, but I meant to say that I didn't see anything that addressed Henry's comment from the 1st patch.

As I stated in the in-line comment within patchset 1, I am unsure if limiting these fields is the right approach.  Maybe we should lighten the restrictions in the CLI."}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2013-08-13 08:23:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2013-08-13 08:24:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Second in-line comment to correct my bad assumption.'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-08-15 17:34:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Do not merge

non-spec attributes are supported, so you can't just whitelist. 'id' should be specifically blacklisted from modification, but that's pretty much it"}, {'account_id': 8278, 'date': '2013-08-20 07:24:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Check attributes when update User via Keystone rest api

Add check tags when update User info, only "name", "password", "email"
"enabled" and "tenantId" can be modified.

Fixes bug 1201251

Change-Id: I406e2a1ba3a8c3c5af35703576fbe4f74117d2bf

[{'created': '2013-08-10 12:31:17.000000000', 'message': 'run_tests.sh can not install Python package

On Ubuntu 12.04, while running run_tests.sh in /opt/stack/nova,
it will install the virtual environment firstly. The Python packages
listed in requirements.txt and test-requirements.txt should be
installed properly. But we need to install 3 packages to pass it:

libxslt1-dev
libmysqlclient-dev
libpq-dev

It is better to install them while installing nova in devstack.

Change-Id: I7ee9427513da98498f39cc16649c4aa7f22824a4
'}]
commit_message:
run_tests.sh can not install Python package

On Ubuntu 12.04, while running run_tests.sh in /opt/stack/nova,
it will install the virtual environment firstly. The Python packages
listed in requirements.txt and test-requirements.txt should be
installed properly. But we need to install 3 packages to pass it:

libxslt1-dev
libmysqlclient-dev
libpq-dev

It is better to install them while installing nova in devstack.

Change-Id: I7ee9427513da98498f39cc16649c4aa7f22824a4

commit_message:
update print operator

H233 can not detect these print operator, but Python will throw
error when switch to python3.x.

Bug #1211540

Change-Id: I49ed48485d63dd5b24e2778662f3efef4d211d23

commit_message:
Increase test coverage for cinder.utils

Add new tests for:
	is_valid_ipv4()
	make_dev_path()
	convert_to_list_dict()
	partition_dict()

Change-Id: I1f3c8b198692e3d9c188b42905608b5d594d9068

commit_message:
Assignment to reserved built-in symbol: dir

In file keystone/common/openssl.py,
BaseCertificateConfigure::_make_dirs(), built-in symbol dir was
re-assignment as local vars, it is easily lead to a misunderstanding, so
rename them.
This patch do not modify any functionality.

Change-Id: I70d6bdc9362577b46b3500de49603f296b6b72e1

commit_message:
Set the image_meta for the instance booted from a volume

If the VM is booted from a volume, image_meta should be retrieved from the field
volume_image_metadata in volume.

Fixed Bug 1191069.

Change-Id: I4df185ab5eeb819327606163565501c845411a7e

subject: remove restarting quantum-plugin-openvswitch-agent

'}, {'account_id': 2340, 'date': '2013-08-09 12:10:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

There's definitely something wrong here, but I'm not sure that removing the notifies is the solution.

Right now, you're supposed to install the openvswitch recipe if you want openvswitch and that pulls in the common recipe. But we should make sure to not rely on the openvswitch recipe if we're not including it explicitly.

Alan might be able to help, since he worked on this before?"}, {'account_id': 7769, 'date': '2013-08-09 14:55:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Indeed, you will want to include the openvswitch recipe if you actually want those packages and agents setup as well as the API server.  This cookbook has been modified to allow the components to be distributed, which definitely means an update to the README on usage will be helpful at this point.

The notifify is definitely wrong, we want something in common functionally equivalent to (which is not valid chef):

  template "/etc/quantum/plugins/openvswitch/ovs_quantum_plugin.ini" do
    source "plugins/openvswitch/ovs_quantum_plugin.ini.erb"
    owner node["openstack"]["network"]["platform"]["user"]
    group node["openstack"]["network"]["platform"]["group"]
    mode 00644
    variables(
      :sql_connection => sql_connection,
      :local_ip => local_ip
    )
    notifies :restart, "service[quantum-server]", :delayed
    if node.run_list.expand(node.chef_environment).recipes.include("openstack-network::l3_agent")
      notifies :restart, "service[quantum-plugin-openvswitch-agent]", :delayed
    end
  end'}, {'account_id': 7769, 'date': '2013-08-09 14:57:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: No score

Typo, should be:

commit_message:
remove restarting quantum-plugin-openvswitch-agent

In the cookbook-openstack-network/recipes/common.rb, for "openvswitch",
it restarts the service quantum-plugin-openvswitch-agent. But it doen't
install the quantum_openvswitch_agent_packages at first. It does not expect
to install openvswitch package or the agent. So I remove the restart action
from the common.rb

Fixes: Bug #1210400
Implements: remove the action to restart the quantum-plugin-openvswitch-agent
Change-Id: Idd22fee926649583653b7d53b8b0bc0ca8eacd07

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but commit message has changed.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-11 12:54:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/03/41303/2/check/gate-neutron-pep8/b2df627 : SUCCESS in 1m 54s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/03/41303/2/check/gate-neutron-docs/f74316b/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 41s
- http://logs.openstack.org/03/41303/2/check/gate-neutron-python26/09272a6 : SUCCESS in 25m 50s
- http://logs.openstack.org/03/41303/2/check/gate-neutron-python27/1dabdf6 : SUCCESS in 17m 39s
- http://logs.openstack.org/03/41303/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-neutron/889b595 : SUCCESS in 19m 35s
- http://logs.openstack.org/03/41303/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-neutron-full/abbe44d : FAILURE in 43m 49s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-08-12 08:41:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Do not merge

Unathourized == 401 whereas Forbidden == 403

* this change introduces backward incompatibility on error response codes
* In theory the 403 error should be used when access to a specific resource is denied, which, to the best of my knowledge, is the case of requests being rebuffed by the policy engine + _validate_network_tenant ownership
* this change can be accepted only if a valid reason is provided for which the solution of returning 403 is actually wrong and 401 should be used instead'}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2013-08-12 18:45:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

When returning 401, the client MAY repeat the request with a suitable Authorization header field; when returning 403, the server understood the request, but is refusing to fulfill it. Authorization will not help and the request SHOULD NOT be repeated as it is. 

As far as I can tell, if the policy engine 'says no', it's no (I don't need to remind you of a popular tv program aired on bbc :)); please, tell me if I am wrong!

Therefore, returning 403 can be  misleading. That said, I filed this bug as a reminder to get the the error code mapping right when we decide to bump the API version. We cannot change the mapping on the existing API as this will break bw compatibility pretty badly, so I guess we got to leave this this for the time being."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-20 06:03:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-20 06:03:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

[{'created': '2013-08-11 12:01:23.000000000', 'message': 'Map NotAuthorized exception to HTTPUnauthorized

the FAULT_MAP in neutron/api/v2/base.py maps NotAuthorized
exception to HTTPForbidden, however HTTPUnuthorized can be more
precise. Most of this exception is PolicyNotAuthorized.

NOTE: function _validate_network_tenant_ownership() will raise
HTTPForbidden directly when try to create port or subnet on a
network which is owned by other tenant.

Closes-Bug: #1210343

Change-Id: I249109afa31686cbfa74301b0728fd1e9afefa90
'}, {'created': '2013-08-11 12:10:05.000000000', 'message': 'Map NotAuthorized exception to HTTPUnauthorized

the FAULT_MAP in neutron/api/v2/base.py maps NotAuthorized
exception to HTTPForbidden, however HTTPUnauthorized can be more
precise.

NOTE: function _validate_network_tenant_ownership() will raise
HTTPForbidden directly when non-admin user tries to create port or
subnet on a network which is owned by another tenant.

Closes-Bug: #1210343

Change-Id: I249109afa31686cbfa74301b0728fd1e9afefa90
'}]
commit_message:
Map NotAuthorized exception to HTTPUnauthorized

the FAULT_MAP in neutron/api/v2/base.py maps NotAuthorized
exception to HTTPForbidden, however HTTPUnauthorized can be more
precise.

NOTE: function _validate_network_tenant_ownership() will raise
HTTPForbidden directly when non-admin user tries to create port or
subnet on a network which is owned by another tenant.

Closes-Bug: #1210343

Change-Id: I249109afa31686cbfa74301b0728fd1e9afefa90

'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2013-08-12 14:22:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I've only given this a first reading and haven't studied all the claims in depth.

I would like to see gluster mentioned only as an example, perhaps in a doc referencing alternative LFS plugins. A few docstrings seem to mention gluster-internal notes, and the overview doc refers to GlusterFS as the canonical way to do LFS. The canonical way should be what is provided in the Swift codebase."}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-08-12 21:06:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

This is just one person's opinion, and if the community feels otherwise, please feel free to ignore this -1.

I don't believe we should be documenting the db broker layer.

The first thing we should do is define an abstract layer for account and container that defines the operations those servers need to fulfull the REST API requests they offer.

Then we define concrete implementation classes, the canonical one is what we have today which, under the covers, is implemented by the current DatabaseBroker classes and it subclasses."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-20 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-20 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

[{'created': '2013-07-12 19:46:14.000000000', 'message': 'Add the lfs_plugin.rst

The document lfs_plugin.rst comes in support of blueprint
"DiskFile and DatabaseBroker as a Public API".
Surely we need some kind of document if this is to become
a public API. "Implementation is the documentation" is not
enough even with docstrings, because there's quite a bit of
explanatory text which does not attach to the code cleanly.

Change-Id: I173cb78683d598c63a3a8e1a55d43199eecfbada

the material not for docstrings. Most of it is currently a
bunch of work items.

Change-Id: I173cb78683d598c63a3a8e1a55d43199eecfbada
'}]
commit_message:
Add the lfs_plugin.rst

The document lfs_plugin.rst comes in support of blueprint
"DiskFile and DatabaseBroker as a Public API". It contains
the material not for docstrings. Most of it is currently a
bunch of work items.

Change-Id: I173cb78683d598c63a3a8e1a55d43199eecfbada

commit_message:
Make horizon listen_port configurable

This patch is aim to add a new param named listen_port to make
apache listen port for horizon configurable. The default value is 80.

Fixes bug #1210719

Change-Id: I0bb1bc7c6d0ef3884d6cbee1af8cc8794d735ae1

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-18 01:38:41.000000000', 'message': "Adding rhel installation element

Adding RHEL support for partitioning

RHEL 6 doesn't create /dev/loop*p* devices for partitions. It does
use device mapper to create the device under /dev/mapper/loop*p*.

This patch adds a common functioon to figure out what operating
system disk image builder is being run on, then decides where to look
for the loop partition.

Change-Id: I5e6ca75de6ab2267486af8b35b76f20c2f17a5e4
"}]
commit_message:
Adding rhel installation element

Adding RHEL support for partitioning

RHEL 6 doesn't create /dev/loop*p* devices for partitions. It does
use device mapper to create the device under /dev/mapper/loop*p*.

This patch adds a common functioon to figure out what operating
system disk image builder is being run on, then decides where to look
for the loop partition.

Change-Id: I5e6ca75de6ab2267486af8b35b76f20c2f17a5e4

'}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-07-24 12:41:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(3 inline comments)

Generally looks good. We should get others to answer the inline question about GET and HEAD not accepting the same parameters.

And ideally, this kind of refactoring might be applicable to the account server as well."}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-07-24 17:38:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

You started with two methods, GET() and HEAD(), doing the obvious things.

You now have one method, _GETHEAD(), that takes an argument "is_head=True/False" and changes its behavior based on that argument.

I fail to see how this is an improvement.'}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-07-24 17:44:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Sam, if GET and HEAD would accept all the same arguments, then we would have the same code shared entirely (which I think it should).

DRY being applied, which I favor here.

However, if HEAD and GET can't take the same parameters (mistake in my opinion) then we only gain a little bit of DRY."}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-07-24 17:57:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Perhaps. I just really don't like methods that do two different things depending on an argument, especially when that argument is hardcoded at the call sites.

FWIW, there are two reasons for the behavioral differences: (a) legacy, and (b) speed. Account and container HEAD requests just have to query the metadata table, not the containers/objects table, and they especially don't have to pull out up to 10,000 rows from that second table, so it lets them be fast.

At least, that's what gholt told me when I tried to do something similar. ;) (See https://review.openstack.org/32647 patch set 1)

Honestly, I think a better way to go might be to make error responses into raisable exceptions and catch them in the controller's __call__, and that way a lot of the duplication around various error handling bits could be pushed down into the helpers.

I'll try to work up a patch and see what happens. I may be talking entirely out of an orifice not generally used for speech."}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-07-24 20:00:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Here, this is sort of what I'm talking about: https://review.openstack.org/38528"}, {'account_id': 6645, 'date': '2013-07-24 20:22:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-07-24 20:54:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-24 21:10:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

For what it is worth, I think reducing duplicate code, DRY principle, is a good thing.  I would rather have conditionals than whole blocks of code duplicated.

That said, as Sam pointed out earlier, there might be a way to achieve the same thing without the conditionals. I would be willing to accept these code changes while researching better ways to remove the conditionals.

But feel free to ignore this +1.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-20 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Factorize GET and HEAD methods

Removed duplicated code between HEAD and GET methods in server.py.

Change-Id: Ib31fccaaab7859c259f41560f86d1e0bedd09a5a
Fixes: bug #1204347

'}, {'account_id': 6738, 'date': '2013-07-05 09:17:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The solution is an elegant method to move checks to a single location and unify exception messages. However, the behavior of the API is changed which, in general, is not a good idea.

User update will generate an exception if ID is modified where there was no exception before.

Project and Group update will generate a different exception than they did before."}, {'account_id': 6738, 'date': '2013-07-05 09:27:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The behavior of the API is changed which, in general, is not a good idea. Also, it is not clear that the move from using attribute_ignore which appears to be set in the config file to immutable_properties which is hard-coded is wise.

User update will generate an exception if ID is modified where there was no exception before.

Project and Group update will generate a different exception than they did before."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-07-08 19:35:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-06 12:27:04.000000000', 'message': "Don't pass RPC connection to pre_start_hook

In review I5bf7795fca21627566ef4f688d45dc83bb953d1b (commit 3349417) we
passed an rpc_connection argument to pre_start_hook() so that we could
create additional queues.

See review Idf12c418a8ce1bc873e7ad6f702351e95d31aca3 for how this was
intended to be used. With oslo.messaging, we'd support doing something
like this by adding support for multiple targets to RPCServer since the
concept of a messaging connection isn't really exposed by the API in
quite the same way.

In any case, this rpc_connection parameter has never been used since it
was introduced, so let's remove it. Let's also move the invocation of
this hook back to where it originally was.

blueprint: oslo.messaging
Change-Id: I9181a3567a1b5a8a6077e78c85f4d28660f275a6
"}, {'created': '2013-08-11 21:08:55.000000000', 'message': "Don't pass RPC connection to pre_start_hook

In review I5bf7795fca21627566ef4f688d45dc83bb953d1b (commit 3349417) we
passed an rpc_connection argument to pre_start_hook() so that we could
create additional queues.

See review Idf12c418a8ce1bc873e7ad6f702351e95d31aca3 for how this was
intended to be used. With oslo.messaging, we'd support doing something
like this by adding support for multiple targets to RPCServer since the
concept of a messaging connection isn't really exposed by the API in
quite the same way.

In any case, this rpc_connection parameter has never been used since it
was introduced, so let's remove it. Let's also move the invocation of
this hook back to where it originally was.

commit_message:
Don't pass RPC connection to pre_start_hook

In review I5bf7795fca21627566ef4f688d45dc83bb953d1b (commit 3349417) we
passed an rpc_connection argument to pre_start_hook() so that we could
create additional queues.

See review Idf12c418a8ce1bc873e7ad6f702351e95d31aca3 for how this was
intended to be used. With oslo.messaging, we'd support doing something
like this by adding support for multiple targets to RPCServer since the
concept of a messaging connection isn't really exposed by the API in
quite the same way.

In any case, this rpc_connection parameter has never been used since it
was introduced, so let's remove it. Let's also move the invocation of
this hook back to where it originally was.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: I9181a3567a1b5a8a6077e78c85f4d28660f275a6

commit_message:
Allow Cinder to call Nova client

This code allows Cinder to call Nova client functions. This will be used
for online migration and guest-assisted snapshots, which are both in
progress.

Change-Id: I9c94917bddcf250b880ca730df463a8402fe6b1d

Add test test_deleting_project_delete_grants

Check that grants are not accessible when we are deleting a project.

Partial-Bug: #1208675

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-14 14:28:06.000000000', 'message': "Remove 'Status' field from healthmonitors details

Since loadbalancer healthmonitor object doesn't have
'status' attribute anymore, this patch removes 'status'
field from healthmonitor details page.

Fixes bug 1211780

Change-Id: I06b77852c7dbc9bc55d1d2aee4b7834fb9f398f1
"}]
commit_message:
Remove 'Status' field from healthmonitors details

Since loadbalancer healthmonitor object doesn't have
'status' attribute anymore, this patch removes 'status'
field from healthmonitor details page.

Fixes bug 1211780

Change-Id: I06b77852c7dbc9bc55d1d2aee4b7834fb9f398f1

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-16 15:20:28.000000000', 'message': "Fix ML2 VXLAN TypeDriver DB migration

The migration for the ML2 VXLAN TypeDriver was incorrectly setting
primary key attributes on separate lines for 'ip_address' and
'udp_port'.

Fixes bug 1213134

Change-Id: I0b2e2685bf524dd9c0333ac4511287ad6a5eb87e
"}, {'created': '2013-08-16 16:48:00.000000000', 'message': "Fix ML2 VXLAN TypeDriver DB migration

The migration for the ML2 VXLAN TypeDriver was incorrectly setting
primary key attributes on separate lines for 'ip_address' and
'udp_port'. Also, a primary key cannot have autoincrement set, so
add this to 'udp_port' as well.

Fixes bug 1213134

Change-Id: I0b2e2685bf524dd9c0333ac4511287ad6a5eb87e
"}]
commit_message:
Fix ML2 VXLAN TypeDriver DB migration

The migration for the ML2 VXLAN TypeDriver was incorrectly setting
primary key attributes on separate lines for 'ip_address' and
'udp_port'. Also, a primary key cannot have autoincrement set, so
add this to 'udp_port' as well.

Fixes bug 1213134

Change-Id: I0b2e2685bf524dd9c0333ac4511287ad6a5eb87e

subject: Switch parameter order of request function.
messages: [{'account_id': 7191, 'date': '2013-08-20 04:11:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Abandoned\n\ndiscard. This is how nova handles it as well so we'll just call this the openstack convention."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-20 03:59:04.000000000', 'message': 'Switch parameter order of request function.

This is inline with the official requests package. I would like to keep
the interface as similar as possible.

keystoneclient has not had a release since this function was added so
this swap is still safe.

Change-Id: I35e307cffe600af215710163de81c6a31cee426e
'}]
commit_message:
Switch parameter order of request function.

This is inline with the official requests package. I would like to keep
the interface as similar as possible.

keystoneclient has not had a release since this function was added so
this swap is still safe.

Change-Id: I35e307cffe600af215710163de81c6a31cee426e

[{'created': '2013-08-19 09:45:04.000000000', 'message': "Use randomly named file for temporay file

Use tempfile.mkstemp to generate temporary
file to avoid collision with an existing 'test'
file in /tmp.

Change-Id: Ic2f7f64ee9826afa6f04debd763e8c7a0eb25988
Fixes: bug #1213845

commit_message:
Use randomly named file for temporay file

Use tempfile.mkstemp to generate temporary
file to avoid collision with an existing 'test'
file in /tmp.

Change-Id: Ic2f7f64ee9826afa6f04debd763e8c7a0eb25988
Fixes: bug #1213845

Yesterday, openstack@lists.launchpad.org was migrated with
all users to openstack@list.openstack.org.

This patch updates references to the old mailing list with the
new, to ensure that people encountering them don't accidentally
try and join the old list!

Change-Id: Ic6701240b0eab542717fc2f99306a1881622ed1a
"}]
commit_message:
Update references with new Mailing List location

Yesterday, openstack@lists.launchpad.org was migrated with
all users to openstack@list.openstack.org.

This patch updates references to the old mailing list with the
new, to ensure that people encountering them don't accidentally
try and join the old list!

Change-Id: Ic6701240b0eab542717fc2f99306a1881622ed1a

commit_message:
Update references with new Mailing List location

Yesterday, openstack@lists.launchpad.org was migrated with
all users to openstack@list.openstack.org.

This patch updates references to the old mailing list with the
new, to ensure that people encountering them don't accidentally
try and join the old list!

Change-Id: If9993dccb50302148209d6098d901427d94d5809

commit_message:
Use the correct url to openstack pypi mirror

The incorrect url only became a problem when trying to install pyudev,
which recently became a dependancy of neutron, but neutron doesn't
list pyudev in it's requirements.txt.

Change-Id: I8ab762c115373d2c8a747567ce06d79bda465f8b

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-19 05:05:30.000000000', 'message': "Remove unnecessary sql checks.

We don't need to check that the user and group exists before checking if
the user is in the group. If the user or group does not exist then there
shouldn't be an entry for it in the user_group_membership table.

Change-Id: I9fba342aafba198460b5f3db17551b656b1a02a1
"}]
commit_message:
Remove unnecessary sql checks.

We don't need to check that the user and group exists before checking if
the user is in the group. If the user or group does not exist then there
shouldn't be an entry for it in the user_group_membership table.

Change-Id: I9fba342aafba198460b5f3db17551b656b1a02a1

commit_message:
python3: Update tox.ini and requirements

Update tox.ini to use setuptools rather than distribute.
Also bump the required version of testrepository that is
more python3 compatible.

Bump the version oslo.config required that is python3
compliant as well.

Change-Id: I8ff429774452405982447c2709fcefca8e703bbd
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

subject: Sync py3kcompat from oslo
messages: [{'account_id': 24, 'date': '2013-08-20 00:49:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-20 00:47:13.000000000', 'message': 'Sync py3kcompat from oslo

Python3 reorganized the standard library and moved several
functions to different modules and combined modules. Six
provides a consistent interface to the module through
six.moves

However urllib/urlparse is not covered by six.moves so
py3kcompat adds python2/python3 compatibility layer for
urllib/urlparse.

As well as StringIO and CstringIO modules do not exist
in python3, here we use six.moves to take care of this
compatibility between python2/python3.

Change-Id: I577b9b2e7badacd8567e40020d2514b3c6ab76a8
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Sync py3kcompat from oslo

Python3 reorganized the standard library and moved several
functions to different modules and combined modules. Six
provides a consistent interface to the module through
six.moves

However urllib/urlparse is not covered by six.moves so
py3kcompat adds python2/python3 compatibility layer for
urllib/urlparse.

As well as StringIO and CstringIO modules do not exist
in python3, here we use six.moves to take care of this
compatibility between python2/python3.

Change-Id: I577b9b2e7badacd8567e40020d2514b3c6ab76a8
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
python3: Fix imports for py2/py3

Python3 reorganized the standard library and moved several functions
to different modules. Six provides a consistent interface
to them through the fake six.moves module.

However, the urlparse, urllib2, etc modules have been combined
into one module which Six does not support so we do it via
py3kcompat.

Change-Id: Id5aaed9fc9ac4ec0389b19748943225a26c37f2c
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Personality files can be injected during server rebuild

Injected files are ignored during a server rebuild, this patch fixes
this issue.

Fixes: bug #1187629

Change-Id: I5e7776de07c8513e36c2926b1fc58c66b382a5ec

commit_message:
Store hash of access as primary key for ec2 type.

In current v3 credential implementation when
a new ec2 credential is created we store it with
new credential id in the backend. This fix is provided
to store the hash of access key id as credential
id when a new ec2 v3 credential is created.

Fixes Bug #1185582

Change-Id: I0ad9aaa3282b101adb6228582f0d24349232ce18

commit_message:
remove refs to keystone.common.logging

A couple references to this module were missed, and a few new ones were
created while it was in the process of being deprecated. This change
removes outstanding references to the module.

blueprint unified-logging-in-keystone

Change-Id: I4cc7614b3f74caaec9dfa100202d9d6db4ebfc36

commit_message:
Remove kwargs from manager calls / general cleanup

Cleaned up keystone.trust.controllers.TrustV3.delete_trust to use
the proper "delete_tokens" method from the token_api.

Added "delete_trust" reference method to keystone.trust.core.Driver.

Named-argument cleanup:

This patch removes some use of kwargs from manager calls where not
required. Dogpile.cache (the targeted caching library) does not
support kwargs out of the box with its cache-key-generator. This
change allows us to support the default cache-key-generator.

Cleanup done on a couple calls in keystone.assignment.core to remove
un-needed named-arguments.

Added a note on keystone.token.core.Driver indicating that
list_tokens should be considered a private method only used by
"delete_tokens" and if treated as such, should not need caching.

In keystone.common.controller.V3Controller._get_domain_id_for_request
fixed named-argument call to token_api.get_token

In keystone.contrib.oauth1.controllers.OAuthControllerV3.authorize
fixed named-argument call to token_api.get_token

partial-blueprint: caching-layer-for-driver-calls
Change-Id: I1fddb4e2db9a24a9ebc544aabe63a3b1fdcfc374

This caching system doesn't handle kwargs and there is potentially a significant overhead to the proper inspection to handle invalidations when the time comes.  I'll include the expanded reasonings in the commit message.  If you look into the BP and the other (recently merged) change, it describes the reasoning for moving to un-named arguments from a named/kwargs style.

commit_message:
Refactor Token Providers for better version interfaces

Cleanup Token Providers to provider a cleaner interface for the
various token versions. Removal of named-arguments/kwargs is
for future caching capabilities.  Due to overhead and problems
with both generating consistent cache keys and invalidates
moving to an "arg" model is better for the manager calls.

Change-Id: I45764ade8bf726c57bf44dba783175bfac5032b4
blueprint: caching-layer-for-driver-calls

commit_message:
Clearer reference to which cloud in devtest.

There is no one single cloud, we need to specify which one is being
setup.

Change-Id: Ib03314c174269214ff636fa0be77d8a93a4b573e

commit_message:
Allow access to HEAT cfn and cloudwatch api's

Specifically access to port 8000 is now needed for the overcloud to work
on Fedora 18.

Change-Id: Ib683e5c275f10bba3062b1a60da7ff5887b317af

This should require a compiler in all the same cases that any Python C extension. The only real difference is CFFI has the option to lazily compile during import. However you can absolutely compile at install (I've done with with a source dist). I've never explicitly tested it but precompiling a CFFI driven package and packaging it with Wheel should absolutely work as well. Similarly I would expect RPMs and DEBs to also be able to work in a precompiled manner."}, {'account_id': 7680, 'date': '2013-07-30 00:40:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

    You should throw some version constraints in the requirements.txt

I had to update my MANIFEST to get the .so in the sdist tarball

    http://paste.openstack.org/show/44106/

You know what's funny, there was this one time (e0987d^1), where like instead of netifaces, swift just shelled-out to ifconfig - lawl!"}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-08-14 16:30:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

My Bad!  So if we're going to package the .so - then we don't want to do sdist/noarch anymore - duh!  Ignore the MANIFEST change please.  Anyone know how package python code that ships c-extensions?  :D

Alex,

Is a homegrown cffi wrapper the only viable replacement for netifaces on PyPy?  Whataremyips is hardly in a critical performance loop - what about just using ctypes/libffi?"}, {'account_id': 7687, 'date': '2013-08-14 17:22:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

You do not need to add the .so (and shouldn't for a sdist). The setup.py of whoever is doing the cffi work should be updated to build the .so on install."}, {'account_id': 7680, 'date': '2013-08-19 22:54:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Abandoned

netifaces actually appears to work under PyPy, so this is no longer a blocker for that.'}]
