[{'created': '2013-07-24 05:44:19.000000000', 'message': 'Removed netifaces dependecy.

This was used for the "whataremyips" function. This function is now
implemented using a custom CFFI binding to the underlying POSIX APIs. This was
done for two reasons:

a) netifaces is not hosted on PyPi and requires scraping to find it, this
   presents both a reliability and security risk
b) netifaces doesn't work on PyPy since it is a CPython C-extension, the new
   cffi code works on both CPython and PyPy.

This code has only been tested on OS X thus far, but is based on some Twisted
code (licensed in a compatible fashion) which is said to work on any POSIX
platform. If a Windows implementation is needed, one can be written.

Change-Id: I0449270d926b91679b7b43f334d61d273c643685

commit_message:
Removed netifaces dependecy.

This was used for the "whataremyips" function. This function is now
implemented using a custom CFFI binding to the underlying POSIX APIs. This was
done for two reasons:

a) netifaces is not hosted on PyPi and requires scraping to find it, this
   presents both a reliability and security risk
b) netifaces doesn't work on PyPy since it is a CPython C-extension, the new
   cffi code works on both CPython and PyPy.

This code has only been tested on OS X thus far, but is based on some Twisted
code (licensed in a compatible fashion) which is said to work on any POSIX
platform. If a Windows implementation is needed, one can be written.

Change-Id: I0449270d926b91679b7b43f334d61d273c643685

[{'created': '2013-08-12 02:12:00.000000000', 'message': 'Handle NeutronClientException when quota exceeded

When networking is provided by Neutron and a security group or a security group
rules quota is exceeded, we get a NeutronClientException with status_code 409
and message "NeutronClientException: Quota exceeded for resources"

This patch updates the neutron security group driver to handle this exception
and translate it to nova's SecurityGroupLimitExceeded

test_neutron_driver is also updated to provide unit tests for this patch

Change-Id: I0fa57b02694221507885ab4bfdb5805e936450e2
Fixes: bug #1209446

When networking is provided by Neutron and a security group or a security group
rules quota is exceeded, we get a NeutronClientException with status_code 409
and message "NeutronClientException: Quota exceeded for resources"

This patch updates the neutron security group driver to handle this exception
and translate it to nova's SecurityGroupLimitExceeded

test_neutron_driver is also updated to provide unit tests for this patch

Change-Id: I0fa57b02694221507885ab4bfdb5805e936450e2
Fixes: bug #1209446

commit_message:
Handle NeutronClientException in secgroup create

When networking is provided by Neutron and a security group or a security group
rules quota is exceeded, we get a NeutronClientException with status_code 409
and message "NeutronClientException: Quota exceeded for resources"

This patch updates the neutron security group driver to handle this exception
and translate it to nova's SecurityGroupLimitExceeded

test_neutron_driver is also updated to provide unit tests for this patch

Change-Id: I0fa57b02694221507885ab4bfdb5805e936450e2
Fixes: bug #1209446

commit_message:
Add Identity v2 project tests

* establish the the form of cliff command classes
* implement some common fake objects
* implement Identity command tests for v2 project
* fix stdout/stderr capture

Also re-work the project create and set commands for exclusive options
(--enable|--disable) to actually behave properly.  Yay tests!

Change-Id: Icbb313db544c1f8dd3c9af7709971838b5a4d115

refactoring, making this a larger commit than might otherwise be
expected.

This also allowed for more and deeper testing, so there are a lot
of new and rewritten tests as well.

Change-Id: I24aed0863689f85898b4bf0b68472a8356280fe2

commit_message:
Primarily updating CLI to support V2

V2 image cli operations build help text based on the jsonschema.
Supporting this as cleanly as possible required quite a bit of
refactoring, making this a larger commit than might otherwise be
expected.

This also allowed for more and deeper testing, so there are a lot
of new and rewritten tests as well.

Change-Id: I24aed0863689f85898b4bf0b68472a8356280fe2

commit_message:
Fix markup of app_demo_flat.xml (Network Guide)

My changes are mainly:
* use userinput instead of computeroutput as appropriate
* add prompts
* use programlisting (only using language="bash" for shell code)
* use filename

Change-Id: I1ae3f45ae24676d6f6e09cfef6497f5fb7a4cb99

commit_message:
Fix bug #1195459 Add sec to Cells chapter

Load cell data from a configuration file

Cells optionally configured through a JSON formatted file

Added a sample file and a feedback sec

Added programlisting language and removed extra white space

Patchset 5 puts in a <?dbhtml stop-chunking?> instruction
so the output file names will remain the same despite the
simplesect markup change.
Also removes a feedback section that is generic.

Change-Id: I05f74ebe7a0bae743b3b7f40215c3eb57ab38f66

commit_message:
Revert "removed deprecated parameter --public"

While trunk devstack was updated for this, stable/folsom and stable/grizzly
are not and grenade is now broken.  I'm not sure how long --public was
undocumented but it may be that certain cli args may need to remain deprecated
but supported for longer than we wish.

This reverts commit ce8636b6b3c4b606483cfb2bc405d86224f309bc

Change-Id: I91d4884e470c8fcc611dae62a30fa22d08dbec03

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-09 21:33:49.000000000', 'message': 'Add ssh check to quantum smoke test.

 * Doing a ping check to verify that a vm is reachable may result
   in a false positive if the target ip is routed in error to a
   nonetheless pingable host.  This patch adds an ssh check that will
   fail if the target is not configured with the expected (and
   dynamically generated) ssh keypair.
 * Adding the ssh check uncovered a bug in security group creation -
   source group rules were being used that restricted traffic to
   ports associated with the security group.  This is now fixed.
 * Addresses bug 1182343

Conflicts:
	tempest/scenario/manager.py
	tempest/scenario/test_network_basic_ops.py

Change-Id: I6b7910f79615335fc50a2e731ed3b57c23bc6b13
(cherry picked from commit af292e8eb7c5318541eb6e88ccde7d5b7c00cb71)
'}]
commit_message:
Add ssh check to quantum smoke test.

 * Doing a ping check to verify that a vm is reachable may result
   in a false positive if the target ip is routed in error to a
   nonetheless pingable host.  This patch adds an ssh check that will
   fail if the target is not configured with the expected (and
   dynamically generated) ssh keypair.
 * Adding the ssh check uncovered a bug in security group creation -
   source group rules were being used that restricted traffic to
   ports associated with the security group.  This is now fixed.
 * Addresses bug 1182343

Conflicts:
	tempest/scenario/manager.py
	tempest/scenario/test_network_basic_ops.py

Change-Id: I6b7910f79615335fc50a2e731ed3b57c23bc6b13
(cherry picked from commit af292e8eb7c5318541eb6e88ccde7d5b7c00cb71)

[{'created': '2013-08-19 15:33:36.000000000', 'message': "testr should not run in parallel unless all the testcases get fixed.

There are many test cases in tests/storage/base.py use same data
inserted into the database for tests, however, when multiple test
cases run at the same time, the data in the database are is
nondeterministic consider the setup and teardown get called many
times. This patch will simply make sure that they won't run parallel.
Other fixes could be using the group_by clause from testr to group
not-process safe test cases together so that at least other test
cases can run parallel.

fixes Bug #1213943

Change-Id: I6cffd2c13908de7927782879bcb4ee6fb738a22d
"}]
commit_message:
testr should not run in parallel unless all the testcases get fixed.

There are many test cases in tests/storage/base.py use same data
inserted into the database for tests, however, when multiple test
cases run at the same time, the data in the database are is
nondeterministic consider the setup and teardown get called many
times. This patch will simply make sure that they won't run parallel.
Other fixes could be using the group_by clause from testr to group
not-process safe test cases together so that at least other test
cases can run parallel.

fixes Bug #1213943

Change-Id: I6cffd2c13908de7927782879bcb4ee6fb738a22d

[{'created': '2013-08-19 19:04:17.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "removed deprecated parameter --public"

While trunk devstack was updated for this, stable/folsom and stable/grizzly are not and grenade is now broken.  I'm not sure how long --public was undocumented but it may be that certain cli args may need to remain deprecated but supported for longer than we wish.

This reverts commit ce8636b6b3c4b606483cfb2bc405d86224f309bc'}]
commit_message:
Revert "removed deprecated parameter --public"

While trunk devstack was updated for this, stable/folsom and stable/grizzly are not and grenade is now broken.  I'm not sure how long --public was undocumented but it may be that certain cli args may need to remain deprecated but supported for longer than we wish.

This reverts commit ce8636b6b3c4b606483cfb2bc405d86224f309bc

commit_message:
Add "Invalid TLD" error message

Currently, when creating a domain, if the TLD doesn't match,
the error message returned is "invalid domain name". An error
of "Invalid TLD" would be clearer to the user.

Change-Id: Iaffbbe2d79a65dccead0f6e82a0b97865aa646a2
Fixes: bug #1208874

commit_message:
fix: bad marker behaves like non-existing marker

From the point of view of the interface, a marker should has only
two states: returning some messages, or returning no messages.
Currently a malformed message marker results in a 400 response,
which makes the marker no longer opaque.

This patch makes the transport respond 204 for a malformed marker
by making storage return an empty iterator in such a case:

  GET /queues/q/messages?marker=malformed  ->  204

This patch also include some clean up on test code.

Change-Id: I1ac7d4bb42af1644bd16d6bca6b7c50a1d700e10
Closes-Bug: #1212389

commit_message:
Update jsonschema requirement.

This commit updates the jsonschema requirement to match what is set
in the global requirement list. It also ensures that a new enough
version is required so that schema validation works correctly.

Change-Id: Ic5159aa4e9b625bffd37cecdfec256e9d65faf0b

I have discussed details with Adam Young and Jamie Lennox. I am working now on moving apiclient to keystoneclient:

https://review.openstack.org/#/q/status:open+project:openstack/python-keystoneclient+branch:master+topic:bp/common-client-library,n,z

It is not decided whether all parts of apiclient will live in keystoneclient (client.py and exceptions.py look like good oslo residents), so I ask to keep oslo.apiclient as is. I am not going to copy it to other clients at the moment, so, this code doesn't hurt anyone."}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-08-19 18:20:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-13 00:11:54.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Implement apiclient library"

The implementation here breaks backwards compatibility.
Additionally, this code is going to be owned and managed in
keystoneclient.

This reverts commit 062cc24f5dfc8e1652a589f6a2f45ce8f3a1b89c.

Change-Id: I593316dd3a722e6fdcb38409be4a2f0ca3bb3caf
'}, {'created': '2013-08-14 04:00:10.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Implement apiclient library"

This reverts commit 062cc24f5dfc8e1652a589f6a2f45ce8f3a1b89c.

The apiclient is a very important idea.  However, that authentication
portion is highly likely to have security updates required in the
future, and having a copied section of code in multiple client
libraries will make patching difficult.

The implementation for this approach has been targetted for the
keystoneclient library, with the understanding that the keystoneclient
will then be used by the other clients to perform authentication.

The code as commited here has not yet been vetted in Keystoneclient.
There are some identified changes that will have to happen before it
is integrated there.  Thus, the version of code that is included in
this repository would have been incorrect very quickly.

The one change not removed with this revert is the addition of the
requests library to requirements.txt.  Removing that change now will
cause test failures elsewhere.

Change-Id: I593316dd3a722e6fdcb38409be4a2f0ca3bb3caf
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Implement apiclient library"

This reverts commit 062cc24f5dfc8e1652a589f6a2f45ce8f3a1b89c.

The apiclient is a very important idea.  However, that authentication
portion is highly likely to have security updates required in the
future, and having a copied section of code in multiple client
libraries will make patching difficult.

The implementation for this approach has been targetted for the
keystoneclient library, with the understanding that the keystoneclient
will then be used by the other clients to perform authentication.

The code as commited here has not yet been vetted in Keystoneclient.
There are some identified changes that will have to happen before it
is integrated there.  Thus, the version of code that is included in
this repository would have been incorrect very quickly.

The one change not removed with this revert is the addition of the
requests library to requirements.txt.  Removing that change now will
cause test failures elsewhere.

Change-Id: I593316dd3a722e6fdcb38409be4a2f0ca3bb3caf

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-19 16:38:03.000000000', 'message': 'Add 'Invalid TLD' error message

Currently, when creating a domain, if the TLD doesn't match, the
error message returned is 'invalid domain name'. Changing it to
'invalid TLD' gives the user a clearer error message.

commit_message:
Add "Invalid TLD" error message

Currently, when creating a domain, if the TLD doesn't match,
the error message returned is "invalid domain name". An error
of "Invalid TLD" would be clearer to the user.

Change-Id: Ic5a8f38aff298b1fbe1b05c4abb505beacb54e2b
Fixes: bug #1208874

commit_message:
Ensure nvp resources are tagged with an up-to-date version of Neutron

This is made possible by using version.version_info

Fixes bug #1213242

Change-Id: Iad75f7c6f6c045a2f473388529174cf02f413899

thanks for the feedback, questions in line.'}, {'account_id': 612, 'date': '2013-08-15 22:14:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thanks for the patch Shawn. Really appreciate you stepping in here.

I'll submit an update for you so you can see the markup that Andreas is talking about.

Regarding the Havana vs Grizzly - we have two branches for docs
trunk - basically* the docs that become Havana
stable/grizzly - the docs that are found at docs.openstack.org/grizzly

If the config option mentioned does exist in Havana but is deprecated, we can certainly include both options.
However, if it it exist in Havana, we probably shouldn't have it in trunk (aka Havana), so we should submit a similar patch to stable/grizzly.


*terms and conditions apply!"}, {'account_id': 612, 'date': '2013-08-15 23:26:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-15 23:28:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
tomcat not required for vmware drivers

Applies to both Grizzly and Havana!

patchset 2 updates screen tags to use prompt and
userinput and rebases

patchset 4 fixes entity reference for > symbol

fixes bug: 1190642

Change-Id: Id1f239b1f99474c40f3159e3cf96f9248ffb23db

If ext-gw-mode extension isn't supported by plugin, it won't
return enable_snat param in router info. Agent will currently
default to enable_snat = false, which changes from expected
default behaviour prior to ext-gw-mode introduction.

commit_message:
Enable SNAT by default in L3 agents

If ext-gw-mode extension isn't supported by plugin, it won't
return enable_snat param in router info. Agent will currently
default to enable_snat = false, which changes from expected
default behaviour prior to ext-gw-mode introduction.

This patch changes L3 agent to enable SNAT by default if plugin
doesn't support ext-gw-mode extension.

Change-Id: I35e8f8c20392bff9ac2f875f2c9a1038ab06ad7b
Closes-Bug: #1212868

commit_message:
Add passing a logging level to processutils.execute

Previously, processutils.execute always logged what commands were
run at DEBUG level.  This is usually fine, but sometimes the caller
wants to log particularly important commands at INFO level instead,
and oslo should allow that.

This is oslo-incubator aa5b65882.  No other significant changes had
been made to processutils in oslo since the last sync.

Change-Id: I09dad3759bf2f759b297ee19205cf0460b9a6baa

[{'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-08-13 07:22:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Just deleting migration will not work.
You need to "connect" previous migration and next one by changing down_revision of the next migration'}, {'account_id': 7787, 'date': '2013-08-13 07:24:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-08-13 07:34:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

In fact removing migration might not be the best way of achieving your goal. Probably it's ok to remove small migration that was added during current release cycle. 
But general guideline is to be able to upgrade from any commit to any commit. I think removing migration breaks this rule.
But I'd like to hear other opinions.
No score for now"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-13 08:09:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
Set BigSwitch plugin to use existing host database model

The BigSwitch plugin had a data model duplicating one
that was recently added into the base portbindings db
file. This patch removes the BigSwitch model and
updates the BigSwitch plugin to reference the plugin-
agnostic model.

Fixes: bug #1211641
Change-Id: I1fdbf8690e71fb2d6e9d6a6dbd0571fa2c32a7e0

commit_message:
python3: Add mox3 dependency

Add mox3 dependency, mox is not python3 compliant so use
the mox3 port to help transition the testsuites to mock.

Change-Id: I2312b0bac69f8bc4d2d23b88a59a2e22f2073a9b
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-17 22:43:25.000000000', 'message': 'Remove strcmp_const_time

This was carried over from Nova and isn't used in Cinder.  Removed
in Nova via commit 08a5066d with message:

"This function was used with deprecated auth and is no longer used
anywhere in the code, so just remove it."

Change-Id: I2b90a1a723265d9d23f89ec03246de8508d591e5
'}]
commit_message:
Remove strcmp_const_time

This was carried over from Nova and isn't used in Cinder.  Removed
in Nova via commit 08a5066d with message:

"This function was used with deprecated auth and is no longer used
anywhere in the code, so just remove it."

Change-Id: I2b90a1a723265d9d23f89ec03246de8508d591e5

commit_message:
Revert "Implement an "Action in progress" error."

This reverts commit faf984cbb5e62980e025191450a02d30aae8e02d.

Multi-engine support is being re-designed to account for the use-case in
bug #1211276.

Fixes bug #1211276

Change-Id: Ief89dd6a9c5014752db8065037dd1dd03efe789e

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-17 13:04:58.000000000', 'message': "revert removal of python-requests<1.2.1 pinning

It disregarded the original reason for the pin in lp 1182271
Also it was invalid as it didn't actually include v1.2.3

Change-Id: Ifb59c0d5eb7fed48b01c67ec19dc79e79657fe2d
"}, {'created': '2013-08-09 02:08:56.000000000', 'message': 'fix invalid python-requests<=1.2.2 pinning

The stated reason for the original pin was invalid
as it used <1.2.3 rather than <=1.2.3

Therefore sync to the global requirements change to
remove the upper bound entirely.

Change-Id: Ifb59c0d5eb7fed48b01c67ec19dc79e79657fe2d
'}]
commit_message:
fix invalid python-requests<=1.2.2 pinning

The stated reason for the original pin was invalid
as it used <1.2.3 rather than <=1.2.3

Therefore sync to the global requirements change to
remove the upper bound entirely.

Change-Id: Ifb59c0d5eb7fed48b01c67ec19dc79e79657fe2d

commit_message:
Add code from Oslo DB 96d1f887dda Part 2

Oslo version 96d1f887dda21b43ba4376187f31953dee6f5273

This commit just adds new db related code from Oslo
into Heat without additional changes

Partially implements blueprint oslo-db-support

commit_message:
message_id is not allowed to be submitted via api

The message_id of sample is not a modifiable value.
So, forbidden it in API.

Change-Id: Ieeb5330d36732fd9ea829b879226c5e5bb8fd083

commit_message:
Api V2 post sample refactoring

Refactoring of the post sample rest api to set the correct
source in the publisher context.
The content of the pipeline is now checked
The admin role special case is now tested

commit_message:
Fixes failed notification when deleting instance

In the notifier plugin for nova, the class Instance that translates instance_ref
returned by conduct.API to nova_client like Instance is not very robust, which
results some attributes are none or missing, and then causes pollsters raise
AttributeError or NoneTypeError

In this change, add the missing or none attributes to the Instance class.

Change-Id: I3e5aa6382021633a6bf7240bf58d3c3bed074785
Fixs: bug #1206731

commit_message:
Fix project_user_quotas_user_id_deleted_idx index

The project_user_quotas_user_id_deleted_idx index in the 203 migration
for the project_user_quotas table was using the wrong column, it should
be using user_id instead of project_id since there is already an index
for the project_id column (defined directly above it).

Fixes bug 1205693

Change-Id: I6899afe5b57432345f69b4ee91ef947a4b9ef5c9

for an example of how easy it is to use.'}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2013-06-18 17:51:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Ray, I thought about doing that. I thought the use-case was a bit different here, but perhaps I'm wrong. Reading through the Kombu code, self.consume() does the 'while True' as well, like we do in ZeroMQ... it just splits that out into a separate method."}, {'account_id': 6539, 'date': '2013-06-18 17:59:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Yes, the forever_retry_uncaught_exceptions should work in your case too.  It basically wraps your forever loop in another forever loop.  As long as the function/method being wrapped can handle a call back to it in the event of an unexpected exception, the decorator will work.'}, {'account_id': 6539, 'date': '2013-06-18 18:31:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Also, I recall when I looked at the zmq code there was more than one thread that might benefit from the decorator.  The idea is to put this decorator closest to the base of the thread to make sure everything is caught.  But you do need to make sure the code being decorated can handle being re-called and does any recovery that might be necessary due to the failure.'}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2013-06-18 18:49:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Right. The method here is a good candidate. The only other place this should be needed is around publisher() in ZmqProxy, but making that work with the decorator will have to wait until I land a dependent patch.'}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2013-06-19 18:35:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2013-06-19 18:37:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Now based on Ray's change. The unit test is identical to one copied from Kombu's tests, except it overrides impl_zmq.ZmqReactor.consume instead of impl_kombu.TopicConsumer.consume"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-19 18:40:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Changing to -1 because there is an easy way to make the tests run faster.  See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/32235/13/tests/unit/rpc/test_kombu.py

Define this method:

    # used to make unexpected exception tests run faster
    def my_time_sleep(self, sleep_time):
        return

And then use this in t eh setup for the tests:

    self.stubs.Set(time, 'sleep', self.my_time_sleep)

It makes the sleeps a noop."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-03 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Make ZeroMQ based RPC consumer threads more robust

Consumers could potentially raise an uncaught exception
and exit prematurely.

Related to bug 1189711

Change-Id: I9cb32d8530f3a1dd623e193476e02b990b40b466

commit_message:
fix broken WSDL logic

vSphere driver incorrectly assumes that a WSDL is locally required.
A local WSDL is only needed as a work-around for certain situations.

Fixes bug 1171215

(cherry picked from commit cf3cc74fcb65de3c59f98db001267e05ae405186)

Conflicts:

	nova/tests/test_vmwareapi.py

Change-Id: I1e17ee54e668eafc3d9d9c9746d996cd66063251

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-15 13:25:58.000000000', 'message': 'python3: Fix imports for py2/py3

Python3 reorganized the standard library and moved several functions
to different modules. Six provides a consistent interface
to them through the fake six.moves module.

However, the urlparse, urllib2, etc modules have been combined
into one module which Six does not support so we do it via
py3kcompat.

Change-Id: Ia89c0fbc0fe7059b7bb95d701084a0de014287b7
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
'}]
commit_message:
python3: Fix imports for py2/py3

Python3 reorganized the standard library and moved several functions
to different modules. Six provides a consistent interface
to them through the fake six.moves module.

However, the urlparse, urllib2, etc modules have been combined
into one module which Six does not support so we do it via
py3kcompat.

Change-Id: Ia89c0fbc0fe7059b7bb95d701084a0de014287b7
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Don't call publisher without sample

Actually when you push samples into a pipeline, and the publishers don't
care of this sample, the publisher is called with a empty array of
samples.

This cause to send unuseful rpc/udp message.

With this change, the publisher is called only when it is needed.

Change-Id: I5811ead70808825e56cf9224b4db888c39034e35

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-11 16:45:42.000000000', 'message': "Handle instance directories correctly for migrates.

In Grizzly we changed how we name instance directories. Unfortunately
the decision as to what directory name to use is based on whether
there is a pre-existing directory on the compute node with the old
name.

In the case of live migration, that doesn't work because we have
libvirt copy the directory across for us. So, we need to pass
around the directory name in the migration request. This is better
anyway, as it means that ops types don't need to handle an instance
directory magically renaming itself at some point.

Resolves bug 1175286.

Change-Id: Ib102e644a8742726fa2049303354d466b8109e0b
(cherry picked from commit 5c11a8c537eb4349e02e8f42468b441c259fbfc2)
"}]
commit_message:
Handle instance directories correctly for migrates.

In Grizzly we changed how we name instance directories. Unfortunately
the decision as to what directory name to use is based on whether
there is a pre-existing directory on the compute node with the old
name.

In the case of live migration, that doesn't work because we have
libvirt copy the directory across for us. So, we need to pass
around the directory name in the migration request. This is better
anyway, as it means that ops types don't need to handle an instance
directory magically renaming itself at some point.

Resolves bug 1175286.

Change-Id: Ib102e644a8742726fa2049303354d466b8109e0b
(cherry picked from commit 5c11a8c537eb4349e02e8f42468b441c259fbfc2)

commit_message:
Raise error when period with negative value

Based on current implement, when use launch below REST API:
GET http://10.1.0.175:8777/v2/meters/port/statistics?period=-1
The result will be 200 OK. No any error reports. This query
should not allow negative value setting but 400 error, and
prompts like this: "Period must be positive.". Just like
setting "Limit" to negative.

Fixes bug 1212159

Change-Id: I8d547fdf8faae2094b24c81da6b233b432bc99ae

These tests seem to be testing things that should be handled in the base service class. 

Shouldn't we be testing that the pipeline was restarted properly?"}, {'account_id': 7642, 'date': '2013-08-10 00:45:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 7642, 'date': '2013-08-12 02:36:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

@Sandy Walsh:

Quote:


"Shouldn't we be testing that the pipeline was restarted properly?"


yes, we should test the pipleline was restarted or not. But i also have a question here. How should i to test it?

IMO, it is not necessary to test the pipeline as test_pipeline.py doing. i want to set up a easy method here, to parse the output of the service and get the configuration of pipeline configure file, compare if it is the same after service was restarted.

Does it make sense to you?


Thanks


Fengqian'}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2013-08-12 15:59:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I would simply check that the id of the pipeline manager changes on consecutive service init calls. We have to assume that the tests for the service manager restart are working from their own unit tests and that the pipeline initializes properly from it's own unit tests. 

However, that does bring up an interesting question. If the service restarts we should confirm that the config is reloaded and not cached/reused by the pipeline manager. This may be a new test somewhere else."}, {'account_id': 7642, 'date': '2013-08-13 02:05:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

@Sandy Walsh:


i agree with you that we need to test pipleine manager restart and with reloaded configure files right. But i still think that it should be reasonable to parse the output of the service to confirm that.

Because we are assuming that the agent service are started from outside. For example, users started service using command line"/usr/local/bin/ceilometer-agent-central --config-file /etc/ceilometer/ceilometer.conf" and the service is restarted after got SIGHUP signal. 

It is not testable to get any inner details from outside, such as pipeline manager configuration or pipeline manager id. So, i would prefer to parse output here, even for the confirm that configure files reloaded correctly. 

What is your suggestion here?


Thanks


Fengqian'}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2013-08-13 13:40:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

Gotcha ... but the test only checks that SIG was caught. It doesn't parse that the config file (or pipeline yaml) is any different. 

Either approach is fine, so long as we're actually checking that the pipeline was reinitialized properly."}, {'account_id': 7642, 'date': '2013-08-14 02:51:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-14 03:03:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Doesn't seem to work

[{'created': '2013-07-31 07:52:23.000000000', 'message': 'Add service restart function

Add signal handler of SIGHUP and service will restart after
receive SIGHUP signal. It depends on blueprint service-restart
of oslo-incubator and blueprint cfg-reload-config-files of oslo.config.

Implements blueprint pollster-runtime-configuration

Change-Id: Icf2597392222d6d97b3dbfd7d48e5ac3b84b175e
'}, {'created': '2013-08-02 06:36:08.000000000', 'message': 'Add service restart function

Add signal handler of SIGHUP and service will restart after
receive SIGHUP signal. It depends on blueprint service-restart
of oslo-incubator and blueprint cfg-reload-config-files of oslo.config.

Implements blueprint pollster-runtime-configuration

Change-Id: Icf2597392222d6d97b3dbfd7d48e5ac3b84b175e
'}, {'created': '2013-08-07 07:38:42.000000000', 'message': 'Reinitialize pipeline manager for service restart

blueprint cfg-reload-config-files of oslo.config.

Implements blueprint pollster-runtime-configuration

commit_message:
Reinitialize pipeline manager for service restart

For central and compute agent, they need to reinitialize
pipeline manager for service restart.
It depends on blueprint service-restart of oslo-incubator and
blueprint cfg-reload-config-files of oslo.config.

Implements blueprint pollster-runtime-configuration

Change-Id: Icf2597392222d6d97b3dbfd7d48e5ac3b84b175e

commit_message:
Fix available zone issue

If a host already added to one aggregation which belongs to one
available zone, then the host should still be allowed to add to
another aggregation if the aggregation does not belong to any
available zone.

Fix bug 1213211

Change-Id: I7a4df14709179eab905b1ea5aa772850c73b8fd8

Reformatted the help outputs in the swift client to bring them more
in line with the rest of the openstack clients. Changes were added to
all of the st_command_help variables and a new variable
st_command_options was added to help with correct formatting of
help outputs.

Patchset #3 fixed st_post_options value to display the correct
help message.

Change-Id: Ic76e7fb567ced0cfa268a61a6ac720e7ac8b5b1e
Implements: changes to help outputs
'}]
commit_message:
Reformat help outputs

Reformatted the help outputs in the swift client to bring them more
in line with the rest of the openstack clients. Changes were added to
all of the st_command_help variables and a new variable
st_command_options was added to help with correct formatting of
help outputs.

Patchset #3 fixed st_post_options value to display the correct
help message.

Change-Id: Ic76e7fb567ced0cfa268a61a6ac720e7ac8b5b1e
Implements: changes to help outputs

commit_message:
Doc: clearly state that one can filter on metadata

Currently, a few examples are given, but it's not clearly stated that it's
possible to run filter on the metadata as well as on the sample fields.

Change-Id: I765abc88e4b658bf3272e0a17d8def3d95eda27e

subject: Also Catch errors from RPC during live migrations
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-26 02:15:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/34485/1/check/gate-nova-pep8/30209 : SUCCESS in 3m 41s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/34485/1/check/gate-nova-docs/24427/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 2m 48s
- http://logs.openstack.org/34485/1/check/gate-nova-python26/25813 : SUCCESS in 21m 21s
- http://logs.openstack.org/34485/1/check/gate-nova-python27/25915 : SUCCESS in 10m 05s
- http://logs.openstack.org/34485/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/26261 : SUCCESS in 41m 13s
- http://logs.openstack.org/34485/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/25967 : SUCCESS in 52m 32s
- http://logs.openstack.org/34485/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/33897 : SUCCESS in 16m 29s
- http://logs.openstack.org/34485/1/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/12868 : FAILURE in 20m 24s (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/34485/1/check/gate-nova-pylint/14795 : SUCCESS in 10m 22s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 6450, 'date': '2013-06-26 09:52:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

"}, {'account_id': 5280, 'date': '2013-06-26 13:41:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thank you.  I'll get a new patch set together that addresses this.

But it does raise a question for me: is the logic in the scheduler here effectively "backwards"?  Currently, if there is an unexpected error when scheduling a live migration, the instance gets stuck in a "Migrating" state and the only way to clear it via the API is to destroy the instance.  That seems bad.

IMO, a more effective approach would be to earmark the exceptional states where it is known that the instance has effectively been lost, and have the default scheduler behaviour be what is currently the "expected exception" behaviour, i.e., try to put things back into a usable state.

Does that make any sense at all?  Am I missing something obvious?'}, {'account_id': 6450, 'date': '2013-06-26 15:49:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I guess those exceptions would be driver dependent. Maybe each driver should be responsible for throwing a specific "InstanceLost" exception for those critical cases where the instance state should be set to error.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-04 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-04 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 5280, 'date': '2013-07-08 17:48:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Restored

The proposed method for handling this error condition did not work in testing, which hints that there are deeper bugs with the conductor API than just what I'm seeing.

As it stands, this "sledgehammer" approach will keep user error from completely breaking VM states, but if a more "surgical" approach is desired, we may need more eyes on this particular problem, since it is highly visible and easily triggered.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-07-10 10:53:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This sledgehammer approach runs the risk of catching masking other errors as well.  Yes, a more surgical approach si desired."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-18 06:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-18 06:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 5280, 'date': '2013-08-11 18:26:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Restored'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-19 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-19 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-26 01:22:19.000000000', 'message': 'Also Catch errors from RPC during live migrations

These get bubbled up from the conductor as RemoteErrors, and are
easily triggered due to user error.  Not handling them results in
instances getting permanently stuck in a "Migrating" state.

Change-Id: I9c5ca64a0413c6fe427dd0377bea297b65fdc3b6
Fixes: Bug 1171526
'}]
commit_message:
Also Catch errors from RPC during live migrations

These get bubbled up from the conductor as RemoteErrors, and are
easily triggered due to user error.  Not handling them results in
instances getting permanently stuck in a "Migrating" state.

Change-Id: I9c5ca64a0413c6fe427dd0377bea297b65fdc3b6
Fixes: Bug 1171526

[{'created': '2013-08-07 03:41:20.000000000', 'message': 'fix heat tests error

commit_message:
fix heat tests error

orchestration tests using admin privilege.

Fixing Bug 1207251

Change-Id: Ie431ef0cf9fe58c310f38bfa6e99d03c7e8b3eed

commit_message:
V2 Client Token Validation.

Implement token validation within the v2 client. Creates a number of
utils functions that extracts functionality from auth_token middleware.
Rearrange the token data from the auth_token middleware tests so that we
can reuse it for validation tests.

This is the first part of bp keystoneclient-auth-token

Change-Id: Ia6d8028cf4c4ee5c0d2e17e7fad5fb3299a68aae

'}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-08-08 12:51:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

I'm worried about the approach here of having shared test files for V2 & V3.  Specifically:

- Although there is a new V2 base class in API samples any in-flight API changes that add tests against the old base class will still merge, and it will take multiple iterations to mop those up.

- Wouldn't it be better to have separate V2 & V3 api_samples test files, so that V2 changes can continue to go though as they are and eventually V2 will be able to remove cleanly from the code base ?"}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-08-08 21:12:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: (2 inline comments)

See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/40858/ and https://review.openstack.org/#/c/38731/ for how v2 and v3 sample tests are split up in the end. '}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2013-08-16 13:01:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I am worried about tight coupling between v2 and v3 tests and weather it will make it more difficult to remove v2 later.

I will change this to +2 if more core people agree with this (it's not too bad really)"}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-08-17 07:53:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14:

I agree that there will be extra overhead in removing V2 eventually by sharing code between V2 and V3. In most cases for tests because there are lots of little differences we've just done a cut and paste job. In this case there were fewer changes required and because the way the integrated tests are structured was fairly straightfoward to share code between V2 and V3 so I took that approach.

That being said, I've no problems with reverting to a mostly cut and paste job if that is what the consensus is. I do think at the low level (eg integrated helpers and api samples) we should still be sharing code because the changes required are really very minor and won't need to be undone when the V2 api is removed."}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2013-08-17 08:24:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Refactor integrated tests to support V2 and V3 API testing

Refactors the integrated test classes so they can be used
for both V2 and V3 API testing. No actual V3 testing is
added in this changeset.

Partially implements blueprint v3-api-unittests
Partially implements blueprint v3-api-specification

Change-Id: Ic7d7b513c3bc19ac1962c0a8489b55e9685fb7c0

commit_message:
Add migration with missing fkeys

There are few ForeignKeys that had been skipped in migrations
and declared in models.
This patch adds these relationships into db by new migration.

bp: db-sync-models-with-migrations

Change-Id: I63e6a853ec16b80ea52b1c0e8a94f8f60819312c

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-16 22:45:44.000000000', 'message': 'Allow downgrading guest MTU settings

Most standard networks will have a 1500 MTU sized
provider network.  Because there is a 24 byte overhead
with using any kind of encapsulation, most users will
want to downgrade the MTU set within their guests or
raise their internal network MTU above 1500.  The former
is much easier to do and has been added as an option to
dnsmasq that is passed to the client.

Change-Id: I199ec6e46c114d0277230eded002ad99786c061c
'}]
commit_message:
Allow downgrading guest MTU settings

Most standard networks will have a 1500 MTU sized
provider network.  Because there is a 24 byte overhead
with using any kind of encapsulation, most users will
want to downgrade the MTU set within their guests or
raise their internal network MTU above 1500.  The former
is much easier to do and has been added as an option to
dnsmasq that is passed to the client.

Change-Id: I199ec6e46c114d0277230eded002ad99786c061c

commit_message:
Fixes Windows setup dependency bug

Fixes bug: #1212385

The neutron project includes a setup hook that allows to dinamically
include setup dependencies.

Due to recent changes in the pbr project, the hook raises an exception
on Windows, which ends the setup process.

This fix solves the issue by adapting the hook to the recent pbr changes.

Change-Id: I4b00d74d23a7167a10ba86458943ff16ca51b0db

Add support for doing language resolution for a request, based on the
Accept-Language HTTP header.

Using the lazy gettext functionality from oslo gettextutils, it is then
possible to use the resolved language to translate an exception message
to the user requested language and return that translation from the API.

Co-authored-by: Luis A. Garcia <luis@linux.vnet.ibm.com>
Co-authored-by: Mathew Odden <mrodden@us.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Add support for API message localization

Add support for doing language resolution for a request, based on the
Accept-Language HTTP header.

Using the lazy gettext functionality from oslo gettextutils, it is
possible to use the resolved language to translate an exception message
to the user requested language and return that translation from the API.

Co-authored-by: Luis A. Garcia <luis@linux.vnet.ibm.com>
Co-authored-by: Mathew Odden <mrodden@us.ibm.com>

Implements bp user-locale-api

Change-Id: Id8e92a42039d2f0b01d5c2dada733d068b2bdfeb

commit_message:
Translate user-facing exception messages

Exception messages should be translated because they can be
visible to users.  Also convert these strings to use named
format parameters in case translation reorders them.

Change-Id: Ife6de17890ba153b8124e91edce6e6d540da3cac

'}, {'created': '2013-08-16 08:08:30.000000000', 'message': "Add UCA repo when building Ubuntu 12.04 images
Ubuntu 12.04 standard repos only contains libvirt-bin.0.9.8, but setup-network script fails if so :
 - --persistent option in virsh net-list is not present in 0.9.8
 - virtualport type='openvswitch' is not available in 0.9.8

Change-Id: I018447c1562edbf71c593785b9a17335c3687322
"}, {'created': '2013-08-16 08:33:06.000000000', 'message': "Add UCA repo when building Ubuntu 12.04 images

Ubuntu 12.04 standard repos only contains libvirt-bin.0.9.8, but setup-network script fails if so :
 - --persistent option in virsh net-list is not present in 0.9.8
 - virtualport type='openvswitch' is not available in 0.9.8

Change-Id: I018447c1562edbf71c593785b9a17335c3687322
"}]
commit_message:
Add UCA repo when building Ubuntu 12.04 images

Ubuntu 12.04 standard repos only contains libvirt-bin.0.9.8, but setup-network script fails if so :
 - --persistent option in virsh net-list is not present in 0.9.8
 - virtualport type='openvswitch' is not available in 0.9.8

Change-Id: I018447c1562edbf71c593785b9a17335c3687322

commit_message:
Testcase to create bulk networks in one API call

Added "test_bulk_create_delete_network" test case in the
test_networks.py script of "api/networks" tests.
Also added supporting method "create_bulk_network" to
network_client.py.

Change-Id: I8325caf5405714686fa2e78c7c1589854e271860
Implements: blueprint quantum-test-extended-coverage

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-11 10:26:32.000000000', 'message': "Added 4 Routers related testcases for Neutron API

This submission adds four test cases namely
'test_create_and_delete_router_with_optional_params',
'test_create_show_list_update_delete_router',
'test_add_remove_router_interface_with_port_id'' and
'test_add_remove_router_interface_with_port_id'.
The supporting methods are added to network_client.py file in
'services/json/' directory.
The script covers the actions 'Create/Delete/Update/Update/Show/Add
Interface/Remove Interface' related to Routers.

Change-Id: Ibed53376a2637105f6163519648bb8a668aaf9c7
Implements: blueprint quantum-test-l2-abstraction

commit_message:
Added 3 Routers related testcases for Neutron API

This submission adds four test cases namely
'test_create_show_list_update_delete_router',
'test_add_remove_router_interface_with_port_id'' and
'test_add_remove_router_interface_with_port_id'.
The supporting methods are added to network_client.py file in
'services/json/' directory.
The script covers the actions 'Create/Delete/Update/Update/Show/Add
Interface/Remove Interface' related to Routers.

Change-Id: Ibed53376a2637105f6163519648bb8a668aaf9c7
Implements: blueprint quantum-test-l2-abstraction

Unfortunately, you can't really add new properties to that particular resource. The schema is defined by AWS here: http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/aws-properties-ec2-eip.html. We may want to extend the schema sometimes, but I don't think it's the case here. Also, it shouldn't be mandatory because it can work without it. And have tests.

In this case, you may want to use OS::Quantum::FloatingIP. Or define default_floating_pool configuration in Nova."}, {'account_id': 7823, 'date': '2013-08-05 09:19:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi Thomas,

  Thanks for your review first, most of your comments I accept,
but I am confused with "because it can work without it. And have tests.", do you mean the EIP works without this change?

I have checked the test_eip.py, it jump the bug locate by using fakes, so tests failed to find this error.

Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2013-08-05 09:27:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Yes, the EIP works without this change. The pool is an optional argument, and only needs to be passed if you don't have a default pool in Nova.

By 'have tests', I mean that if the changes ought to be accepted, they need to change the unit tests too."}, {'account_id': 7135, 'date': '2013-08-05 09:33:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

BTW, the default pool can be set in nova.conf - default_floating_pool."}, {'account_id': 7823, 'date': '2013-08-05 09:36:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Git it, thank you very much, I will revert this commit and just add an indication related with the "default_floating_pool" for user.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-08-08 16:05:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Do not merge

This patchset adds a 'FloatingIpPool' property for ElasticIp,
the main reason for this changing is the requirement to provide
a floating ip pool parameter for nova().floating_ips.create(),
otherwise, the error 'FloatingIpPoolNotFound' will be reported.

Fixes bug #1206865

commit_message:
Catch "FloatingIpPoolNotFound" in eip.py

This patchset catch the "FloatingIpPoolNotFound" exception in eip
of heat, the floatingippool cannot be configured by heat currently
but it can be assigned by setting 'default_floating_pool' in
nova.conf

Fixes bug #1206865

Change-Id: Idd0fd39f5470904dd351a39f66a57781d9f7c444

[{'created': '2013-08-12 16:14:06.000000000', 'message': 'Adding HOT str_replace and get_resource functions

This patch adds support for two functions, get_resource and str_replace to HOT
to enable the definition of new HOT samples. Especially str_replace aims to
simplify the definition of scripts in HOT templates.

Change-Id: Ic14fee36bdc0b9c5d79ade7ece5fa1b5331c864a
'}, {'created': '2013-08-13 06:41:23.000000000', 'message': 'Adding HOT str_replace and get_resource functions

This patch adds support for two functions, get_resource and str_replace to HOT
to enable the definition of new HOT samples. Especially str_replace aims to
simplify the definition of scripts in HOT templates.

Change-Id: Ic14fee36bdc0b9c5d79ade7ece5fa1b5331c864a
'}]
commit_message:
Adding HOT str_replace and get_resource functions

This patch adds support for two functions, get_resource and str_replace to HOT
to enable the definition of new HOT samples. Especially str_replace aims to
simplify the definition of scripts in HOT templates.

Change-Id: Ic14fee36bdc0b9c5d79ade7ece5fa1b5331c864a

Fix dictionary changed size during iteration

Make a copy of the keys before we operate on it

Fixes LP# : 1212854

Change-Id: I431ffb3878863e9be6d1a35078f7d7c3edf4b133

commit_message:
Sort distro packages

Distro packaging systems have real depenency graph generation. Keeping
the files in sorted order helps with merge conflicts.

Change-Id: Ida9ab191d39ae818dcd9ff5bde61cdb5a733ff0f

commit_message:
Replace assertEquals with assertEqual

assertEqual is deprecated upstream. We've got a pending hacking check
to prevent using the wrong one (because seriously, who the heck can
remember?) But we wanted to clean out nova before landing the hacking
check.

Change-Id: Ib342314e2a74e175a0a145af32032de99d2e9767

commit_message:
Ignore common files that should never be added.

These files should never be added to the repository, so should be
ignored as the will be created by commonly used editors.

Change-Id: I9698a4b91d18368def786d708df156eaf69a87a6

commit_message:
New fixtures release.

There is a new fixtures release out which fixes a critical bug
(missing testtools dep) and also makes replacing Popen easier to work
with.

Change-Id: Ife0c6d3ef77903040d797557ecb27e55e4a0f3e9

commit_message:
Uncap testscenarios.

I'm pretty good with backwards compat, and the other libraries I
maintain are not capped which is inconsistent.

recheck no bug'}, {'account_id': 7680, 'date': '2013-08-17 04:05:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The reason pep8 doesn't catch this one is that our tox.ini has builtins = _ (https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/tox.ini#L47), and then we use gettextutils.install(), which omnkeypatches it in place. I'm a big proponent of reducing that monkeypatching, and we've managed to remove it from swift, nova, and neutronclient. Removing it from cinder would also be great in my opinion!"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-17 04:43:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

[{'created': '2013-08-17 20:41:20.000000000', 'message': "Fix rabbit driver handling of None, etc. replies

Just like the bug in the fake driver, we have a similar rather
embarassing and obvious bug - we're currently not allowing endpoint
methods to send replies of None, '', False, [], {}, etc.

Change-Id: Icf0abdfcf122c5757dd3737f66130b3a53769ef6
"}]
commit_message:
Fix rabbit driver handling of None, etc. replies

Just like the bug in the fake driver, we have a similar rather
embarassing and obvious bug - we're currently not allowing endpoint
methods to send replies of None, '', False, [], {}, etc.

Change-Id: Icf0abdfcf122c5757dd3737f66130b3a53769ef6

commit_message:
Consolidate the definition of vmware config options into __init__.py

the vmware group was defined in vmops.py where there was just one
option that was registered. vnc_port_total is defined in driver.py
BUT used in vmops.py without a CONF.import_opt. Let's move all the
definitions into __init__.py to avoid issues in the future.

Change-Id: I0515e1171c93e5ac1a27e46d04ad81b518e3ebb3

commit_message:
Remove ConfFixture from toplevel public API

There's no need to make the fixtures, testtools, etc. libraries a
runtime requirement, so let's move it from the toplevel oslo.messaging
API so you need to explicitly import it.

Change-Id: I9e2f32a898d78489f2d8d9c218c81f35cda14e34

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-16 10:09:06.000000000', 'message': "Fix fake driver handling of failure replies

The driver reply() method is actually passed a full sys.exc_info()
tuple.

This was masked in the unit tests because the driver ended up basically
doing:

  raise (ValueError, ValueError, ...)

which caused a new ValueError to be instantiated and the test was
satisified. However, if an exception type has some required arguments,
you'll get a TypeError when this statement attempts to instantiate it
with no arguments.

Change-Id: I4af9c5084954d7b9c5f02cdae3387d17c206985b
"}]
commit_message:
Fix fake driver handling of failure replies

The driver reply() method is actually passed a full sys.exc_info()
tuple.

This was masked in the unit tests because the driver ended up basically
doing:

  raise (ValueError, ValueError, ...)

which caused a new ValueError to be instantiated and the test was
satisified. However, if an exception type has some required arguments,
you'll get a TypeError when this statement attempts to instantiate it
with no arguments.

Change-Id: I4af9c5084954d7b9c5f02cdae3387d17c206985b

[{'created': '2013-08-16 20:25:22.000000000', 'message': 'Fix is_cinder_installed check

The is_cinder_installed check had a bad path
specified and would always return FALSE, thereby
always skipping tests that needed it.

This patch fixes the check to work properly.

Now that tests are running again a bug has been
detected in one of the tests, that test is now marked
with a skip and and a defect has been submitted/listed.

Fixes bug: 1213226

Change-Id: I280f005b1eac4c4eb523f803de7df3e8a2d1aba9
'}]
commit_message:
Fix is_cinder_installed check

The is_cinder_installed check had a bad path
specified and would always return FALSE, thereby
always skipping tests that needed it.

This patch fixes the check to work properly.

Now that tests are running again a bug has been
detected in one of the tests, that test is now marked
with a skip and and a defect has been submitted/listed.

Fixes bug: 1213226

Change-Id: I280f005b1eac4c4eb523f803de7df3e8a2d1aba9

commit_message:
Don't relabel devstack-gate nodes

We now count on the gearman plugin to take these nodes offline
when the build is complete, so there should be no need to prevent
other jobs from running on these nodes with the relabel hack.

Change-Id: I859c506451f885c9e0fd318766aa1aa454fe7b3d

I agree with the comment that '******' should probably be some var somewhere but don't think that should block this being merged."}, {'account_id': 860, 'date': '2013-07-18 13:12:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The change to auth_token.py seems overkill because:

- It's on the vendor/provider side, who will (potentially) have access to even more user data

- It's only logged with debug level -- presumably most people won't log at debug level until they need to debug something...which brings me to my next point

- When debugging a problem you need to know *which* token is causing a problem. Imagine a user claiming that their all their requests are failing. They claim to be using a valid token, but when you switch on debug, you find that in fact they are using something else (i.e., they have a bug in their code).

- Finally, tokens expire. So if you get an unauthorized access to the logs at a later date, the token value is useless and does not revile anything about the user."}, {'account_id': 2807, 'date': '2013-07-18 15:47:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: No score

- It's on the vendor/provider side, who will (potentially) have access to even more user data

Private cloud deployments are likely to send log feeds from the cloud to a centralized enterprise logging system.  The logs feeds may be traveling in the clear.  And, the log feeds may have people access it that are not cloud administrators.  So I disagree with this viewpoint.


- It's only logged with debug level -- presumably most people won't log at debug level until they need to debug something...which brings me to my next point

Log levels in OpenStack today are not terribly useful.  Many people run with debug at all times because info doesn't provide enough information for security compliance.  Ironically, without patches like this, running at debug is both necessary and bad at the same time.


- When debugging a problem you need to know *which* token is causing a problem. Imagine a user claiming that their all their requests are failing. They claim to be using a valid token, but when you switch on debug, you find that in fact they are using something else (i.e., they have a bug in their code).

For this level of debugging, you can always look at network traffic on the wire.


- Finally, tokens expire. So if you get an unauthorized access to the logs at a later date, the token value is useless and does not revile anything about the user.

They do expire, but not very quickly.  Having a compromised token available for a day is a big deal."}, {'account_id': 6867, 'date': '2013-07-21 14:20:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (8 inline comments)

Thank you very much bdpayne, Dirk, Dolph and Donagh for your reviews.

I understand the needs expressed by Donagh, but I do share the analysis of bdpayne. Production environments have to deal with many  security issues and would prefer to avoid applying additional recommendations to prevent risks bound to log files containing short-lifetime (but reusable) tokens.

In short, the main intent of the proposed changes is that security measures in code development prevail over debugging instrumentation.

I prepare patch set #4 to take into account all your comments.


Notes :
  - for bdpayne : I have taken into account previous comments regarding potential regressions.
  - I got additional comments from a relationship of mine:
      . I will remove reference to Django filtering mecanisms in the commit message.
      . I will remove comments refering to the bug number and purpose from the code.'}, {'account_id': 6867, 'date': '2013-07-21 14:38:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-21 15:47:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Doesn't seem to work

FYI: Swift logs the auth token in the proxy log. I've proposed a fix -- see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/38294/.

For backward compatibility reasons I've left the default as-is (many real world Swift implementations roll their own auth layer). However, implementors can choose to obscure the
token."}, {'account_id': 6867, 'date': '2013-07-24 21:31:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6867, 'date': '2013-07-24 21:49:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Donagh, the patch you proposed for Swift may be a compromise.
 
However, according to me, it still misses for a recommendation about the right length to use in the prefix configuration parameter in order to both satisfy:
  -developpers (who need enough information to retrieve and trace the right token in the log entries)
  - operators and security officers (who may require that none or very limited information are published in log files).

In order to recommend a right lenght (and possibly enforce it rather than letting users to choose there own value), we have to figure out:
  1) the typical length of a token (is it a constant? Is there a minimal length?);
  2) the typical effort required to crack a token knowing only its first bytes.

Another possible approach to potentially "solve" this issue would be to log a hash of the token, rather than the token itself.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-24 22:18:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

"}, {'created': '2013-07-21 14:38:35.000000000', 'message': 'Make sure python-keystoneclient does not log sensitive information.

The Python Keystone client handles password when asking for the authentication
of users and administrators, and gets a token when authentication succeeds.

Passwords are long-term sensitive information that must not appear in the log
files of an Openstack production environment.

Tokens are short-term sensitive data that can be reused to get access-
controlled Openstack services for a 24 hours period, on behalf of their actual
owner, and without reauthenticating.

Developpers may feel convenient to get as much information as possible to debug
the Python Keystone client, but this must not increase the risk for sensitive
information leakage in production environments that would have failed to apply
security procedures to get a secure Openstack instance.

Therefore, each line of code generating log entries have been reviewed in
order to remove token information and replace passwords with a specific, non-
sensitive constant.

Fixes: bug #1004114

Change-Id: I67232a3a1fb96eb2ac1bf9515d281e5f7608afc8

commit_message:
Make sure python-keystoneclient does not log sensitive information

The Python Keystone client handles password when asking for the authentication
of users and administrators, and gets a token when authentication succeeds.

Passwords are long-term sensitive information that should not appear in the
log files of an OpenStack production environment.

Each line of code generating log entries have been reviewed in order to
replace passwords with a specific, non-sensitive constant.

Fixes: bug #1004114

Change-Id: I67232a3a1fb96eb2ac1bf9515d281e5f7608afc8

'}, {'created': '2013-08-16 18:57:23.000000000', 'message': "Fix 'olso' typo in lib/oslo

This enables commit If92073be5a431840701c952a194e63a7c452c9ca
for cleaning up potentially installed older oslo.config. Here are
its original details.

If the user had oslo.config installed prior to us setting up the
oslo.config out of git they can get themselves into this very funny
situation where pip doesn't see oslo.config 1.1.x, however some
packages might. This manifests itself as a user error trying to
start nova-api which uses DeprecatedOption, not in oslo.config 1.1.x

Because of the funny state pip is in, you can't uninstall oslo.config.

So in these situations, if we see old oslo.config in the filesystem,
pip install / uninstall it to ensure that everyone ends up using the
git version instead.

To reduce the amount of user confusion, do this on every
install_oslo for a while, which we can purge after Havana ships.

Change-Id: I7fa0b70497bf5622f4638da284afe5363a004d3c
Fixes: bug #1213089
"}]
commit_message:
Fix 'olso' typo in lib/oslo

This enables commit If92073be5a431840701c952a194e63a7c452c9ca
for cleaning up potentially installed older oslo.config. Here are
its original details.

If the user had oslo.config installed prior to us setting up the
oslo.config out of git they can get themselves into this very funny
situation where pip doesn't see oslo.config 1.1.x, however some
packages might. This manifests itself as a user error trying to
start nova-api which uses DeprecatedOption, not in oslo.config 1.1.x

Because of the funny state pip is in, you can't uninstall oslo.config.

So in these situations, if we see old oslo.config in the filesystem,
pip install / uninstall it to ensure that everyone ends up using the
git version instead.

To reduce the amount of user confusion, do this on every
install_oslo for a while, which we can purge after Havana ships.

Change-Id: I7fa0b70497bf5622f4638da284afe5363a004d3c
Fixes: bug #1213089

subject: use generic service names
messages:
[{'account_id': 7, 'date': '2013-08-08 12:41:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Hmm, I'm not a fan of this... it means that for cookbooks that need to restart some nova service (such as what is necessary when certain Quantum configurations change), we cannot subscribe to the "nova-api" service, we now need to pull in platform options and figure out the name of the service according to Chef.

I think it's easier and simpler leaving it the way it is.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-08 12:56:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/49/40849/1/check/gate-cookbook-openstack-compute-chef-lint/bc87815 : SUCCESS in 4m 45s
- http://logs.openstack.org/49/40849/1/check/gate-cookbook-openstack-compute-chef-style/c3e6c62 : SUCCESS in 5m 36s
- http://logs.openstack.org/49/40849/1/check/gate-cookbook-openstack-compute-chef-unit/8691889 : SUCCESS in 11m 02s
'}, {'account_id': 216, 'date': '2013-08-09 00:06:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I actually don't mind this approach all that much.  Honestly, it doesn't look like it really benefits us all that much, but again, I don't mind the change.  It's more of a purists change, since the service is defined with the proper name originally vs re-defining it inside the service block.

As for @jaypipes comment, I would probably consider it an anti-pattern for other openstack cookbooks to restart openstack services.  The compute cookbook restarts many diff services when a shared config is modified (nova.conf), but I don't believe we would need to worry about openstack-network needing to restart nova-api.

However, I do see Jay's point, and could go either way."}, {'account_id': 2340, 'date': '2013-08-09 09:16:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I think the current way we define services is a bit confusing since we always have to have two names in mind, the generic name and the ubuntu name. When writing a notify, I'd have to go looking for where the service was defined, rather than just using the generic attribute.

See also the discussion we had on the mailing list about this: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!msg/opscode-chef-openstack/35D1-w0mak4/k2MIOUbNZlUJ"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-17 06:03:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-17 06:03:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

commit_message:
use generic service names

Use the platform-specific service names that we already have in the
attributes file. This also simplifies the service resource declarations.

Change-Id: Ibf320cd139a7cc0942589c607e02bd28cc12bd84

I'd strongly recommend a unit test for this change."}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-08-09 10:18:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I am not the author of this code, but I believe there is a reason for disabling host route injection for subnets with a gateway.

In the same environment one might have both 'isolated' and 'routed' network (the latter being networks connected to a router). In the former case traffic will be forwarded to the metadata proxy in dhcp namespace, whereas in the latter case traffic will be forwarded on the default route.

I understand your concern and see a possible solutions in that the route should not be injected only if the network has a network:router_interface port (might require extra query, performance impact at scale should be evaluated) - and therefore is definetely connected to a router.

Would something like that work for you?"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-17 06:03:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-17 06:03:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-06 19:42:19.000000000', 'message': 'Remove metadata route injection restriction

When using the enable_isolated_metadata flag, if gateway-ip is
set (implicitly or explicitly), dnsmasq will not inject the metadata
route, presumably under the assumption that a subnet with a gateway will
rely on the router owning the gateway IP to handle metadata
routing. However, in our deployments we have found many valid use-cases
for subnets with external routers but internal metadata via the
metadata-agent. It seems that this scenario is exactly what "isolated metadata"
should entail, but the current code checks for enable_isolated_metadata
and that gateway-ip is not set.

Without this change, an awkward workaround is required to have an
external gateway-ip and metadata route injection, by passing the default
route as a static host route, disabling the gateway-ip attribute and
adjusting the allocation-pool to account for the gateway IP, like so:

subnet-create --no-gateway --host-route \
destination=0.0.0.0/0,nexthop=x.x.x.1 --allocation-pool \
start=x.x.x.2,end=x.x.x.254 net1 x.x.x.0/24

This gateway_ip check seems to be an unnecessary restriction.

Change-Id: I72285b8d51139a181b38b301f5835a22b803368b
'}, {'created': '2013-08-07 21:15:51.000000000', 'message': 'Remove metadata route injection restriction

route, presumably under the assumption that a subnet with a gateway will

for subnets with external routers but internal metadata via the

and that gateway-ip is not set.

Without this change, an awkward workaround is required to have an
external gateway-ip and metadata route injection, by passing the default
route as a static host route, disabling the gateway-ip attribute and
adjusting the allocation-pool to account for the gateway IP, like so:

subnet-create --no-gateway --host-route \
destination=0.0.0.0/0,nexthop=x.x.x.1 --allocation-pool \
start=x.x.x.2,end=x.x.x.254 net1 x.x.x.0/24

This gateway_ip check seems to be an unnecessary restriction.

Fixes: bug #1209396
Change-Id: I72285b8d51139a181b38b301f5835a22b803368b

commit_message:
Remove metadata route injection restriction

When using the enable_isolated_metadata flag, if gateway-ip is
set (implicitly or explicitly), dnsmasq will not inject the metadata
route, presumably under the assumption that a subnet with a gateway will
rely on the router owning the gateway IP to handle metadata
routing. However, in our deployments we have found many valid use-cases
for subnets with external routers but internal metadata via the
metadata-agent. It seems that this scenario is exactly what "isolated metadata"
should entail, but the current code checks for enable_isolated_metadata
and that gateway-ip is not set.

Without this change, an awkward workaround is required to have an
external gateway-ip and metadata route injection, by passing the default
route as a static host route, disabling the gateway-ip attribute and
adjusting the allocation-pool to account for the gateway IP, like so:

subnet-create --no-gateway --host-route \
destination=0.0.0.0/0,nexthop=x.x.x.1 --allocation-pool \
start=x.x.x.2,end=x.x.x.254 net1 x.x.x.0/24

This gateway_ip check seems to be an unnecessary restriction.

Fixes: bug #1209396
Change-Id: I72285b8d51139a181b38b301f5835a22b803368b

commit_message:
Enable AvailabilityZone in AWS::EC2::Volume

Previously, the AvailabilityZone passed to the volume was ignored.

*** WARNING ***
The tests are currently failing. This patch is provided for reference only.

Backported from parts of:
 - Ic5c838d406313bca6c36d1106a53ad458dd12aa6
 - I83ea2f3f0c417eb9e97abdf27a9eaffd441cb070

Change-Id: Ibb297365d18e087c2af8575461d162f6f2ea1405

commit_message:
bugfix - messaging role was specified incorrectly

* use newer verion of openstack-compute to match swap out of
config_by_role to search_for

* updated spec file to use the http instead of https for uri's.

Change-Id: Iac7ca12f9d84cb2560c1e0b0b99bdb443eb13cab

Hey,

some comments in-line!

There's also another thing I don't like and I'd love to get your thoughts about it.

This patch registers config parameters when the modules are imported. IMHO, this behavior is 1. a bit rude 2. Conflict prone. In order to avoid that, would it make sense make the app call a register_configs function?

Also, I think those config parameters should be registered in a glance(client) group instead of using DEFAULT.

Thoughts?

One more thing, this patch is pointing to an OUTDATED dependency. 

Thanks for the patch!"}, {'account_id': 1726, 'date': '2013-07-09 22:10:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: (16 inline comments)

Thanks and many more thanks to you, Ghe.'}, {'account_id': 5347, 'date': '2013-07-26 20:06:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

Overall I really like this direction. However I have a couple of concerns with the Glance V2 implementation. There are some fundamental differences compared to V1 and this service layer may need to do a bit more work in a couple of areas to present a common facade over both V1 and V2.

Ones I notice offhand:
- The service will need to make two calls to the client on behalf of the caller to handle a create with image data to simulate the V1 functionality.
- V2 does not recognize purge_props so if purge_props is true it will need to fetch the existing image and create a PATCH request that explicity deletes or updates properties to achieve the same thing as the old purge_props.
- It may be desirable to expose an upload function which would map to the V1 update and the V2 upload functions."}, {'account_id': 1726, 'date': '2013-07-29 10:12:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: (2 inline comments)

Thanks for pointing this out. v2 support is still on progress (is not even complete on glanceclient but on the way).

Will prepare an extra patch for the update and create method, and think about how to deal with the update/upload differences in v1/v2.'}, {'account_id': 7701, 'date': '2013-07-29 10:44:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: (1 inline comment)

Check inline'}, {'account_id': 1726, 'date': '2013-07-30 12:10:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-30 13:06:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Works for me
