'}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-08-08 13:25:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

what about just ./run_tests.sh test_content_types, this should work.

I remember there was some discussion about it sometime ago with termie that the tests would broke when we were adding tests/__init__.py I can't remeber the exact reasoning maybe dolph or another keystone reviewer who was part of that discussion can chip in."}, {'account_id': 6282, 'date': '2013-08-08 13:31:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I tried ./run-test.sh test_module, however couldn't run test cases in sepertated module with virtenv."}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-08-08 13:44:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I haven't used run_tests.sh lately it is advised to use tox these days, you can just do like this:

tox -epy27 test_content_types

the full log :

http://pastie.org/8218631"}, {'account_id': 6282, 'date': '2013-08-08 14:16:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

however, don't you think ./run-test.sh support seperated module test taste good?"}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-08-08 14:19:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

IMO: we should remove run_test.sh and make people using only tox and I think the infra was agreeing it was the way forward, http://permalink.gmane.org/gmane.comp.cloud.openstack.devel/356

but that's just my opinion i let the other reviewer give their opinion."}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-08-08 14:22:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

fyi: the reverted review of that file https://review.openstack.org/#/c/24105/'}, {'account_id': 6282, 'date': '2013-08-08 15:33:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I do like run-test.sh, directly using tox was not as simple as it.'}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2013-08-13 21:24:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

We should push forward with tox. 
Not sure how to specify a single module to run, but i'm sure it's possible."}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2013-08-13 21:55:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Steve - Tox works just like runtests would in this case, e.g. "tox -epy27 test_auth.AuthTest".  You can also specify to the module level too, if you're interested in all tests in a given module.  

I think that the sentiment here is appropriate, push forward with tox over runtests.

IIRC run tests is deprecated (across all openstack projects, please correct me if I am wrong)'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2013-08-14 00:51:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Do not merge

This change is not needed.  I've gone back and circled around on it to verify, you just need to omit the "tests" from before the test module name.

e.g. Use "./run_tests.sh test_content_types" instead of "./run_tests.sh tests.test_content_types"

I'll also get a comment up on the bug.'}, {'account_id': 6282, 'date': '2013-08-16 12:37:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Add __init__ for seperated module unittest

Add __init__.py file in tests dir. Seperated module unittest could run
with cmd: ./run-test.sh tests.test_module

Fixes bug #1209030

Change-Id: Id684c8ae866f63b006771f2766f1ae990bb82e54

[{'created': '2013-07-31 15:50:52.000000000', 'message': "Config drive attached as cdrom

Some guest OSes (e.g. Windows) require config drive to be a cdrom device
to access the iso9660 filesystem on it. Option config_drive_format is
therefore set to also control the device type of config drive. If it's
set to 'iso9660', config drive will be cdrom; if it's 'vfat', config
drive will be disk.

DocImpact
Fixes: bug #1155842
Change-Id: I6c08b1b8040a1fd0db8e2b3b1fc798060733001f
(cherry picked from commit 7f4b5771633f519a54aae985ae526418114b1a29)
"}]
commit_message:
Config drive attached as cdrom

Some guest OSes (e.g. Windows) require config drive to be a cdrom device
to access the iso9660 filesystem on it. Option config_drive_format is
therefore set to also control the device type of config drive. If it's
set to 'iso9660', config drive will be cdrom; if it's 'vfat', config
drive will be disk.

DocImpact
Fixes: bug #1155842
Change-Id: I6c08b1b8040a1fd0db8e2b3b1fc798060733001f
(cherry picked from commit 7f4b5771633f519a54aae985ae526418114b1a29)
